description: A teenager and her dads move into a forsaken home with a grim past. As the family makes renovations, a darkness takes root within them.
tags: ['teenager']
synopsis_with_character_names:
The teenager Scarlett is in the call with her parents, Michael and Troy, driving to their new home. They sing along with the radio, and a disgusted Scarlett begs them to stop, and they jokingly complain about her being a wet blanket. Scarlett texts back to her friend Shanti that they're almost at their new home. They get to the house and go inside, and Scarlett looks around the place.

Going back to her fathers, Scarlett tells them that she hasn't seen any ghosts yet. Troy says that ghosts don't exist, He talks about how popular the Haunted Mansion ride is at Disneyland, and how popular Halloween is in America, and people loved to be scared. Michael talks about how they'll renovate the place and turn it into a branded stay, and the couple isn't concerned about the fact that people died there. The men insist that neither of them believe in ghosts, and Scarlett says that she isn't frightened by the house and just liked their old house, and her parents assure her that they'll never be homeless and Scarlett's college is paid for. They share a group hug.

Once the men go upstairs to check out the second bedroom, Shanti texts Scarlett and Scarlett sarcastically says that she hopes the ghosts kill her. She goes to her new room to unpack, and a red ball rolls into the room and bumps her foot. There's nobody in the hallway, and a red ball rolls in again. There's still nobody there, and as Scarlett looks around in the hallway a door creaks open behind her. Scarlett peers into the closet revealed and finds a black rubber suit. She takes it takes it to her room and puts it on, and admires herself in the full-length mirror. Scarlett sees a reflection of a man wearing the same suit and quickly takes off the suit, then goes out of the house and tosses the suit in the garbage.

Later, Scarlett sits in her science class as the teacher talks about the amygdala being the part of the pain that regulates fear. When the teacher suggests that deadening the amygdala can stop other emotions, Scarlett says that it's easy not to be afraid, and people do it all the time, and shame stops people from doing what they want. The other girls giggle and figure Scarlett is feeling shame about something. Afterward, Scarlett goes to her locker and a girl from her class, Maya, jokingly says that Scarlett has been staring at her. Scarlett dismisses it as her not getting much sleep, and Maya says that she didn't say she didn't like it. Maya compliments Scarlett's smarts and walks off. Shanti comes over and asks what was going on, and Scarlett says that she thinks Maya was flirting with her.

Over lunch, Scarlett tells Shanti what Maya said. Shanti isn't convinced that Maya was flirting, and Scarlett insists that Maya was. Shanti figures that Maya was screwing with Scarlett, but Scarlett doesn't believe it. Her friend says that Scarlett desperately wants it to be real

That night at the house, Scarlett lies in her bed, imagines Maya in bed with her, and masturbates. Scarlett imagines strangling Maya, then climaxes. Later as she sleeps, the Rubberman appears above her as she sleeps. She wakes up from her nightmare screaming .

Scarlett sits in her bed and looks at Facebook photos of Maya. Maya texts Scarlett and says that her friends don't know a few things about her, and Scarlett texts that she's not officially out at school. Maya invites her to a sleepover, and says that she'll protect Scarlett from her bitchy friends. Then the two of them can together once the others are asleep. Scarlett smiles and agrees.

The next day, Michael and Troy are redecorating the house when Scarlett comes by. They have her sit down and talk to her and they've discovered that she's still looking at "extreme" porn on her computer, and she's moved on to more disturbing material. Scarlett angrily says that it's none of her business what porn she looks at, but they point out she's 16 and the level of pain and suffering that girls are suffering at the sites Scarlett visits is not good for her to see. Michael asks her if she imagines being the masochist or the sadist, and Scarlett refuses to talk to her parents about it. Troy says that they're going to have her see a therapist, and they figure it goes beyond normal. Her parents say that she's grounded the upcoming weekend, and Scarlett says that she has a slumber party to go to with Maya and her friends. Scarlett begs her parents not to ground her, and they give in but say the therapist, Dr. Ann Grant, will be at the house the next day. They tell her there's a difference between sex, and something dark and unhealthy.

At school in science class, Maya texts Scarlett and smiles at her. Back at home, Scarlett goes to her room, tries to bring up humiliation porn, sites, and discovers that her parents have locked her out. Her closet door opens on its own, revealing a Rubberman suit. Scarlett puts the suit on, her eyes turn black, and she picks up a knife. She goes to her parents' where Troy is running a bath, and comes in. Michael is on the bed reading, and calls Troy in. Scarlett giggles and removes the hood, and says "Gotcha". Her parents aren't amused, and she says that she threw the suit away but thought they put it in her closet. Michael says that they didn't, and Troy tells her to take it off and take a hot shower, and they never want to see it again. Scarlett says that she's keeping it, and angrily says that they can't control her mind and body. Troy tries to rip it off her and Scarlett accidentally cuts him on the arm with the knife. Michael binds the cut, and takes his husband to Urgent Care to get stitches. Troy tells Scarlett to go to her room, and won't be talking to her for weeks. Crying, Scarlett goes to her room.

The next day, the family meets with Grant at the house, and Scarlett wonders if the therapist is saying that she's a freak. Grant says that Scarlett isn't a freak, and they should explore the reasons for Scarlett' atypical behavior. Troy asks why Scarlett tried to scare them, and his daughter says, and Scarlett vaguely says that she thought it was funny. Michael admits that they prank each other all the time, and he tells Grant that they tend to be overprotective because when Scarlett was 3, she was kidnapped, when someone stole their car with her in it. A woman whose ex had murdered her own daughter found Scarlett and thought she was a replacement, and Scarlett doesn't remember the 10 days she was missing.

Grant worries most about the house, Scarlett's fathers insists the house isn't haunted, and Grant agrees. She figures that Scarlett has been "possessed" by the stories, and Grant feels the heaviness in the air when she came in. The time runs out for the session, and Grant says that she wants to see all of them in a week, as well as a separate session with just Scarlett. She goes to use the restroom before she goes, and Michael says that Scarlett isn't going to the slumber party. Scarlett curses both of them and blames them for moving into the house, wishes the kidnapper would have kept her, and storms out.

When Grant leaves the restroom, she finds a red ball on the floor. She sees and hears a child giggling and running off, and goes after them into the basement. A boy says that Grant is going to die there, and the Rubberman comes up behind her, cuts her throat, and Grant's body falls down the stairs into the basement.

That night, Michael finds the suit on the hallway floor, and a pool of blood nearby. He takes the suit to Troy and they burn it in the fireplace, and Troy points out that they don't know whose blood it was. They figure it was Scarlett's time of the month, and go to take Xanax and watch TV.

In her room, Scarlett gets a text from Maya and says that she's grounded because she accidentally stabbed her father. Maya tells Scarlett to sneak out if she's "hardcore", and Scarlett does so. At the slumber party, Maya talks about how they're fake and Scarlett agrees. Maya tells Scarlett that she doesn't conform to superficial standards like everyone else does. Nicole asks Scarlett if she's a "lezzie", and they talk about what makes a girl a virgin lesbian. Scarlett says that she snuck out, and Maya tells her that she needs to be wearing pajamas because it's a slumber party. She goes to get a pair of hers, and leads Scarlett off.

Maya takes Scarlett to her room and gives her a pair of her shorties, and Scarlett takes off her outer clothes to put them on. Admiring her, Maya says "Wow" and Scarlett says that she wore her undergarments for Maya. Maya helps Scarlett put on a pajama top then kisses Scarlett's neck. Scarlett turns and asks Maya if she's experimenting because she thinks she might be gay, and Maya says she's serious and wonders if it matters. They sit on the bed and kiss, and Scarlett says that she's a virgin. Maya admits that she is as well, and was hoping that Scarlett would show her what to do, or has watched porn. Scarlett says that the porn she watches wouldn't be helpful, and Maya promises she won't judge Scarlett if she goes into details. The younger girl says that she likes violent stuff, and Mays says that sounds hot and has Scarlett tell her more. Scarlett does so, and Shanti texts her telling Scarlett to stop, saying the girls area livestreaming the whole thing.

Scarlett sees a phone set up in the nearby bathroom, facing them, and opens the bedroom door to see the other girls looking at their phones and giggling. Scarlett runs out of the house and gets in her car, crying. She calls Shanti and asks how much everyone heard, and Shanti confirms that they heard the whole thing. Scarlett figures everyone thinks she's a pervert, and Shanti tells Scarlett not to look at the comments. The crying girl figures her life is over and hangs up, and drives off while the girls watch her from Maya's bedroom window.

At the house, Scarlett goes to her father's bedroom and tries to talk to them, but they're asleep. She kneels in the shower and turns the showerhead on, crying, then gets out and calls Maya. Maya tells her it was the most fun they had in weeks. Scarlett says that the fun isn't over yet, and she's going to end the night by killing herself. Maya doesn't believe her, but Scarlett insists that it's true and that she's going to leave a note stating very clearly that the girls are the reason why. She reminds Maya of the case at Rutgers and the men responsible were arrested. Maya, panicking, says that they were just messing around, and Scarlett says that if they're not all at her house in 30 minutes, she's going to do it. Scarlett hangs up and looks at the gimp suit next to her.

The girls drive to the house and the other girls are reluctant to go in, but Maya insists that they have to go in together. They go in and the front door slams shut behind them, and Maya's phone rings. It's a text from Scarlett, who tells them to go down to the basement. The door slams and locks behind them, and Maya figures Scarlett is probably filming it to embarrass them. The four girls go down the basement stairs and look around, and Maya tells Scarlett to come out. They look in a hole, and Infantata lunges out at them. The girls shriek and run, Maya first, and a figure in the rubber suits stabs Maya in the chest. The figure then kills the other three girls.

The figure removes her hood, revealing that she's Scarlett. The last girl, Rowena, isn't quite dead and begs Scarlett to stop. Scarlett finishes Rowena off with the knife.

The next day, Michael and Troy come in and find Scarlett patching up the shaft in one room. They tell her that she did a good job and Michael wonders why she's doing it. She says that she thought it would be a fun project to try, and apologizes about lying to them about browsing the S&M sites. Her fathers hug her and say they're sorry for not being good helping her with her feelings, and Scarlett says that at least they try. The men go down to breakfast, and Scarlett stays behind to tidy up. Before they go, their daughter tells them that she's a sadist, not a masochist. They tank her for that and go.

After they go, the ghost of Grant appears and tells Scarlett that they should have a session about what Scarlett has done. Scarlett says that she's good, and that she has never felt better in her life. The girl goes and finds Rubberman waiting for her in the hallway.

description: Scarlett enters a twisted new romance while Michael and Troy are forced to confront their rocky relationship.
tags: ['halloween', 'halloween costume', 'spirit', 'mask', 'ghost', 'rubber suit', 'haunted house attraction']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Gladys runs as Ruby McDaniel pursues her, wielding a knife. Running away, Gladys falls over a balustrade, lands at the bottom of the stairs, and breaks her leg in the fall. She limps away, and Ruby walks down and comes after Gladys. Gladys runs to the basement and Scarlett dressed as Rubberwoman stabs her repeatedly in the stomach, then looks at the arriving Ruby and smiles.

Later, Ruby and Scarlett take a bath together. Ruby says that her parents died when she was six, in a car crash. She was sent to live with her Uncle Tony. He was a sadist who eventually hurt her. Scarlett hugs Ruby and says that she's sorry, and Ruby says that on her 16th birthday Tony drove her to her parents, revealed they were still alive, and told her that they sold Ruby to him when they were done with her. Ruby says that she died inside when she saw them, and she decided to kill herself. She did it in the Murder House, knowing about the place's reputation, but she didn't know that if anyone dies there, they're stuck there forever. The realtor who was selling the house buried Ruby's body in the backyard so no one would find out and ruin the chances of the house being sold, Ruby asks Scarlett to come and be there with her, and Scarlett should kill herself so they can be together forever. When Scarlett hesitates, Ruby submerges herself completely in the bathwater then disappears.

Halloween comes, and detectives Juarez and Chapman come to the House. Scarlett sees them arrive, and the detectives arrive with Michael and Troy. The detectives explain that four girls went missing, and Troy says that they have nothing new to offer since the last time the detectives came by. The police got a warrant to check Scarlett' phone records, and have confirmed she called the girls an hour after the livestream. The girls' Snapchat tracking shows they all drove there together, and about 20 minutes later their phones stopped transmitting. Chapman suggests someone drove the girls' car back to Maya's house and walked back. The fathers don't believe Scarlett was involved.

When Juarez suggest the men were involved, Troy says that they're not talking to them further without their lawyer present. As the detectives go, Juarez says they'll be in touch. Once the detectives leaves, Scarlett comes down from her room and her fathers asks if there's something she wants to tell them. The girl insists that she didn't hurt the four girls, and suggests maybe the ghost killed them.

That night, Scarlett is on her bed clutching the knife and hears the ghosts whispering for her to join them. Grant appears and says that they had a session, and death hasn't stopped her ambition. Maya and the others kill Grant and Maya points out that Scarlett can't kill them again. Their leader, Maya, says that they can torment Scarlett for a long time and make sure she doesn't sleep at night. Ruby comes in and throws her knife past the girls, and says that they're not going to do anything. She tells them to stay away from Scarlett, and intimidated, they leave. Scarlett grabs Ruby and kisses her, and they slip to the floor together.

Two months later, Michael, Troy, and Scarlett meet with Grant--unaware that she's a ghost--and tell her that Scarlett still hasn't gotten over the girls' disappearance. Michael saw one of the ghosts, Pig Man, He ran and got Troy, but the time they got back the ghost had disappeared. Michael figures that Troy was hallucinating, and Scarlett points out that they've been fighting for the last month. Troy figures that Michael is pretending the House is haunted to get him to sell it so they can move out, Michael points out that they're going broke from their investment in the House. Grant suggests to Troy that it might be time to reconsider his dream, but Troy isn't convinced. Michael admits that he's scared and says they're all in danger, and wonders if the stories about the House are true. Troy figures Michael is trying to get Grant to validate his concerns, and Michael says Grant was here when he got home. Grant calls an end to the session and says she'd like to meet with them in a week, and sees herself out. Scarlett tells her fathers that she likes it there, and likes the pain inflicted there.

Later, Troy takes contractor Adam around the House and says that they've been doing the work on it themselves, using Youtube videos. He takes Adam upstairs to the second bedroom and shows him around, and dismisses the family's work. Adam says that they're not saving any money, and Troy admits that he's been dipping into Scarlett's college Fund. He begs Adam to help them, and says that Adam had a shirtless photo on Angie's List. Michael comes in, and Troy introduces Adam to him. When Michael points out that they don't have the money to pay Adam, and sarcastically tells Troy that a couple of blowjobs won't make up the difference. Adam says that he'll come back and give them a rough estimate later, and says that he can find a way to make it work for all of them. Troy agrees and Adam leaves, and Michael tells Adam that he's cruel, getting off on hurting people. He's known it all along, but says that Troy has never turned his cruelty on him before. Michael says that Troy flirting with Adam in front of him is an act of violence towards their marriage. Troy says that he needs some fun since his husband started "cavorting with the dead", and Michael tells him that their marriage is in trouble, and need to get out of the House. Troy says that they're over their heads and need to hire Adam to finish the job, and afterward they'll have a talk about where their marriage is going. Ruby is secretly listening to the two men talk.

Later, Troy and Adam have sex and Troy tells his partner that it has to be their secret, and Michael can't know. Adam says that he just got out of a bad relationship with a woman and can sympathize with Troy, and Troy says that Michael is apparently losing his mind and he can't stand his spouse anymore. He says that Michael's negativity is the issue, and Adam tells Troy that he should have as much sex with him as possible, to distract him until the job is done. They kiss, and they're interrupted when Adam's underline Martin calls to him.

Michael is in the second room examine the covered-over crawlspace, and Martin brings Troy and Adam in and says that judging from the stench, there's a dead raccoon walled up in the crawlspace. Adam breaks down the bricks and finds the girls' rotting corpses where Scarlett hid them. Michael and Troy said they had no idea, and Adam bashes in Martin's skull and says that the three of them are in it together. He says that he has a couple of outstanding lawsuits against him and a divorce, and might have stolen some client funds. Michael wants to all the police, but Troy stops him. Adam suggests they put Martin in the crawlspace with the other corpses, put some lime in, and wall them all over. He figures then they'd be partner, and he likes the haunted B&B idea. Michael agrees as long as Adam stays away from their marriage, and Adam says that he wants in on that as well. When Michael refuses, Adam tells Troy to tell Michael, and Michael demands the truth. Troy says that he screwed Adam and the two spouses get into a shoving match.

Michael throws Adam out, but they find Rubberman at their door. He kills Adam, and Michael and Troy run to Scarlett's room and confirm that she's not there. Michael is sure Scarlett wasn't in the suit, and they to the back door but find the ghosts of Martin and the girls waiting for them. They run out of the house, but find themselves back in the house. Michael hugs Troy and says that he's sorry, having worked out that Ruby killed them both. Ruby comes in and watches the couple as they hug.

Scarlett come home from school looks around for her dads, and finds the opened crawlspace. The ghosts of Adam and Martin confront her, and Scarlett runs out and finds her dead fathers in their bedroom. Their ghosts are sitting nearby and say that they need to talk. Scarlett runs out and closes the door, and Ruby stops her and tells her that it's okay, and now Scarlett has no excuse not to stay.

Michael and Troy talk to Grant, who says that being murdered is a very traumatic experience and that's why they don't remember being murdered. The therapist says that it's traumatic, and the couple repressed the memory as a coping mechanism. Troy is less than thrilled that they're trapped in a prison of more of the same. Grant is happy that she's working with the other therapist there on a book to help all of them, and Michael asks how Scarlett feels about everything that's happening. Scarlett figures that no one is going to hurt her there, particularly Ruby, and admits that Ruby is her girlfriend and killed her fathers to keep them there. Her parents aren't happy, and Scarlett points out that she can come and go as she wishes. She goes to get ready for a Halloween party, and Troy wants the name of the other therapist in the House.

In her room, Scarlett puts on the rubber suit, and sees Ruby behind her in the mirror. When Scarlett turns, there's no one there. Then Ruby appears again and says that she can go with Scarlett on Halloween. They kiss and leave, while the girls watch them go and wonder if they should spend their one free night of the year getting revenge on Scarlett for killing them.

Scarlett and Ruby go the party at Griffith Park, and Scarlett figures that if Ruby hadn't killed her dad, they would probably have gotten a divorce. Scarlett assures Ruby that she's the love of her life, and being together with her eternity sounds like heaven. She admits that she might not be ready to give up the world yet, and makes Ruby promise not to rob her of that choice. Ruby promises and they kiss, and Ruby says that she wants to have a non-stop orgy of trouble and pain.

The two girls dance, and Shanti finds Scarlett and figures Ruby is the reason Scarlett never texts her back anymore. Ruby tells Shanti that she's boring, and Shanti runs off. When Scarlett objects, Ruby admits that she's possessive and Scarlett runs after Shanti. Scarlett finds Shanti, alone and crying, and Shanti tells Scarlett that Scarlett was her only friend and then the girls disappeared. When Scarlett admits that she used that an as excuse to not come back to school, Shanti suggests that she might be a psychopath. Scarlett insists that she's trying to protect Shanti from her home life, and Shanti says she already figured out that Scarlett killed the girls. She needed Scarlett to talk to her about all of it, and she told the cops she didn't think Scarlett could do anything bad but that was a lie, and figures Scarlett is capable of anything. Shanti says that she doesn't want Scarlett in her life anymore, and Scarlett walks off.

The girls approach the crying Shanti, and Maya tells Shanti that she should have told the police about Scarlett. When they prepare to whip her to death, Ruby arrives and tells them to stop or she'll peel their faces off every day for the next thousand years. The four girls back off, and Ruby tells Shanti that the girls won't bother her again. Shanti tells Ruby that if Ruby loved Scarlett, she'd set her free. With that, she walks off.

Scarlett walks through one of the haunted walk-thrus, and finds Ruby killing two men. Ruby invites Scarlett to join in, and Scarlett draws a knife and advances on her victim. The girls come in and kill the victim, and tell Ruby that if they kill Scarlett outside of the House, Ruby will be stuck without Scarlett forever. Scarlett runs out, Nicole chasing her. Nicole's living boyfriend William sees her and calls to her, and she hugs him.

Scarlett hides, ready to stab anyone who comes after her. Ruby appears and walks Scarlett home, and says that she and the other three girls went at it all night, but she finally defeated them. Scarlett prepares to tell Ruby something, just as Maya and the others arrive. They back off when they realize Scarlett is telling Ruby something about going back into the house. Scarlett tells Ruby that she doesn't want to be in the house with Ruby the rest of her life, and wants to live in the outside world. Maya admits they were awful and lets Scarlett to go inside and get her things, and say goodbye to her dads. Nicole and William come up and hug, and Nicole asks William to tell the police where their bodies are, but he should never come inside. Ruby tells William to tell the police that she killed Nicole and the others, so Scarlett won't be blamed.

As Scarlett packs, Michael asks her where she'll go. She says that she's not sure, and maybe she'll go aboard with the cash from their 401Ks. Scarlett asks if they're going to be okay, and Michael figures they don't have any more stress about money or the future so they'll do fine. They all hug goodbye and Scarlett walks out.

Ruby is waiting for Scarlett at the front door, and they hug and Scarlett tells Ruby that she's the only person in her life whose suffering brings her no pleasure. Ruby says the same and they kiss. Scarlett smiles and walks out the front door,

10 Months Later

Scarlett is in a car on the highway. She calls Ruby, who is having breakfast to the other ghosts. Ruby picks up and says that everything is going fine, and Troy reminds Scarlett that Halloween is in two months, and he and Michael are going are gladiators. Scarlett tells Ruby that she found Tony and she's going to torture and kill him for Ruby. They exchange sentiments of love, and Scarlett goes to Tony's house wearing the rubber suit and carrying a hammer. She knocks on the door and when Tony answers the door, hits him on the head with the hammer.

Ruby waits until Scarlett comes to see her on Halloween, and the two of them hug.

description: A screening of a forbidden film has disastrous consequences.
synopsis_with_character_names:
In Chad's bedroom, Chad and Kelly are making out. Chad tries to unbutton Kelley's pants, but she pushes his hand away. She says that she's not comfortable, and figures that they don't have to rush it. Chad asks if it's him, and Kelly assures him that it it's not him but she just likes to take her time. He points out that she didn't wait when she with her former boyfriend, and she takes offense and goes home.

The next day, Chad goes to the skate park with his friends Milo and Quinn, and talks about what happened. They suggest Chad take Kelly to a drive in movie to get her in the mood, and the people restoring a local drive in got a copy of Rabbit Rabbit, the most infamous cursed film in cinema history. It was only shown once in '86, and six people were dead after the screening was over. The survivors said the audience went crazy, and the director was dragged before Congress and all the prints were destroyed. One of Chad's snagged tickets to the limited showing,

Back at home in her room, Chad watches video of the hearing with the director, Larry Bitterman. Tipper Gore questions Bitterman about how he claimed his movie would destroy people's souls. Bitterman says that he was promoting his movie, and Gore says she got a letter from Bitterman's studio saying they were going to pull the movie and destroy every print in existence. The director goes berserk and attacks Gore, and the guards pull him away.

At school, Kelley talks to her friend Dee about her relationship with Chad, and Dee friend suggests that Kelley is afraid of sex. Dee goes over to talk to her boyfriend, Milo, and Chad comes over to Kelley, apologizes for pressuring her into sex, and invites her to the drive in.

That night at the drive in, Rabid Ruth is outside the fence protesting against the movie. The manager Verna is more worried about how the delivery man hasn't arrived with the print, and the one screening will put them in the black. If they have to give refunds, they'll go broke.

Chad and Kelley pull in, and Chad figures Ruth is a promotional gimmick. After parking, they go to the snack bar. Milo and Quinn are there and they all talk about the movie. Dee is at the snack bar, and Kelley goes on ahead to get some snacks. The deliveryman arrives with the print and takes it to projection booth, and Ruth comes to the nearby fence and calls Chad over. He goes, and Ruth tells him to cut the power and stop the movie. She says that she was there in '86, and halfway through the movie her boyfriend was dead and she lost her eye, and her boyfriend ripped her eye out and swallowed it. Kelley comes over and asks for help, and Chad goes with her.

Verna sets up the projector, and the deliveryman looks over her shoulder and gives her projecting advice. She says that she doesn't need it, and the deliveryman leaves. The movie starts up and in the car, Chad tells Kelly what Ruth said to him. Chad figures Ruth wasn't a plant, and Kelley admits she's a little scared and puts her head on Chad's shoulder. She tells Chad that she wants to make that night special and kisses him.

Dee is in a car with Milo, giving him a blowjob. The movie starts and Dee looks up at the screen.

Kelley and Chad kiss, and Kelley looks up and at the screen. Chad tells her to forget the movie.

Verna watches the screen from the booth.

Through the drive in, people stare at the screen in fascination, their eyes turning bloodshot. Meanwhile, Ruth sneaks up to the booth and heads for the projector's power cord.

Chad hears a scream and points it out to Kelley, then looks over at a nearby car that's shaking.

The usher, Tillis, comes in and asks Ruth what she's doing there. Verna turns, her face laced with veins, and throws Ruth to the floor. The owner drives a pair of scissors into Ruth's remaining eye, then gets up and charges at Tillis.

Dee bites off Milo's penis and spits it out, her face distorted. She then lunges at him.

Kelley figures it's a joke like Ruth. Someone breaks through the window on Chad's side, and Chad grapples with his attacker back while Kelley drives the car off. Chad finally kicks his opponent out, and Kelley slams into other cars and Dee jumps on the hood. Kelley stares at her friend in shock, and slams into the snack booth's wall, crushing Dee. Chad tells his girlfriend they have to go, and they run inside as more of the now-frenzied patrons chase after them. The couple run up to the booth and close the door behind them, and they see Ruth's and Tillis' bloody corpses on the floor. Their faces are chewed off, and the landline is dead while they don't have their phones. Looking out the window, Chad sees the berserkers chasing down and killing anyone that isn't affected, flipping over cars.

Verna attacks Kelley as Kelley finds some shotgun shells, and Chad beats Verna in the head with a movie reel and beats her head until she's dead. He stops the movie but it's too late, Chad dozes off and wakes up the next morning. Kelley has been watching and tells Chad that a lot of the afflicted ran off, She figures the police won't believe them, and reminds Chad that Milo said there was going to be another screening that night. Since the print came from Bitterman, she figures they have to find him and get the second print.

Kelley has found the shotgun that goes with the shells, and Chad takes the scissors from Ruth's eye socket. They go out and Kelley looks at her dead friend's corpse on the car hood. Quinn, afflicted, comes slowly at them and Chad can't get through to him. When Quinn lunges at him, Chad stabs him in the chest with the scissors, and tells Kelley they have to hunt Bitterman down.

The couple track Bitterman down by the delivery receipt. The former director is living in a trailer in the desert, with a limo parked next to it. Inside, Bitterman is watching a newscast about the chaos, and he says that he made cinema history. The couple come in and confront Bitterman, explaining that they were at the screening. Kelley says that they want the other print, and Bitterman claims that he only has one print. Bitterman realizes that they weren't paying attention to the movie and that's why they're unaffected, and asks them to describe what happened. When they do, Bitterman is thrilled that everyone watching was affected. He says that it was a cinematic experience, where the horror is the audience.

Bitterman tells them about the subliminals in 'The Exorcist', which caused viewers to throw up. He was the second assistant editor and was partially responsible, but the movie didn't win an Oscar that year. Bitterman took it to the next level and raised money for his own movie, learned everything he could about subliminals, and put it into 'Rabbit Rabbit'. When his editor Lanie saw the finished product, she cut her own fingers off They put her away, blaming drugs and overwork, but Bitterman knew his subliminals worked. He released the movie in one special venue, and the audience went berserk. Gore turned her attention to Bitterman and had the movie banned, and had Bitterman sent to prison for 15 years on assault charges. Bitterman spent his time in prison perfecting his technique, and when he got out he applied it to a work print he had hidden away.

The director tells the teenagers to appreciate the big picture, and that they were witnesses to history. Kelley shoots Bitterman in the knee, and Chad knows that the movie at the drive in was a copy, so Bitterman must still have the original. When Kelley threatens him with the shotgun, Bitterman tells them where the original is. Chad destroys the print on the oven burner, and the couple walk out as the trailer explodes from the flames right after Bitterman yells that his name will go down in history.

The couple go back to Chad's bedroom and have sex. 'Rabbit Rabbit' airs on Netflix as Bitterman, and outside, the city burns as people go berserk.

description: A group of influencers face a reckoning after posting a problematic video online.
synopsis_with_character_names:
The four influencers of Bro House-Zinn, Wyatt, James, and Barry-put out a video saying they're going to do crazier than everyone else, for likes.

5 Days Till Christmas

The Bros hang out at "Suicide Bridge" in LA until a jumper comes along. Barry wants to call the police, but Zinn says that the police would never get there in time so they should record. Barry films it all while the others chant "Bro House", and the man jumps. Zinn figures it's an easy million-subscriber spike, and wants to post it despite Barry's objections that they might get a backlash.

That night, there's a party at the Bro House. Zinn wants to post the video, but Barry still is unhappy with the whole thing. Zinn insists that they have to up the content to get the views, and makes Barry promise to get his mojo back. Barry agrees, and Zinn rides a skateboard down the stairs and then jumps onto a Christmas tree below. The suicide video goes up and the guests, disgusted, walk out.

The next day, Zinn tells the others that they're down followers and people are posting to complain. Barry says that there's an online petition to get Bro House shut down, and the dead man's family is holding a press conference later that day to denounce them. He suggests that they make an apology video, but Zinn refuses, figuring they'll be accused of being fake and get more hate. Zinn figures they have to "go gay." James agrees, but Barry warns that it smells like another train wreck and Wyatt agrees with him. Workers from their sponsor, Kraken Energy Drinks, pull up and start taking away the items they sent the Bros. Zinn figures that they'd better go gay.

Soon the Bros are doing "gay things", saying "no homo" after each one. Wyatt keeps saying he's "no homo" to get it on the record," and they lick spilled ice cream off of James' chest. They still keep losing subscribers, and girls mock them as they drive by them on the streets. Barry suggests they "get back to their roots" by doing dumb stuff. Zinn agrees, and says that they should out during Christmas and act goofy.

The Bros go to a mall and they go up to a mall Santa. They say that they're getting into the Bro House Christmas spirit, go up to the Santa elf assistant, and asks if they were the ones who filmed the suicide. and ask her sexual questions about elves and Santa. Another little person elf comes over and tells them to turn off their phones and leave, and threatens to call security. The Bros go up to Santa and Zinn announces that Santa isn't real. Santa tells them to leave now, and Zinn twerks him. The mall Santa knocks Zinn down and says that he'll get what he deserves, and the Bro run when security approaches.

Christmas Eve

At the Bro House, the Bros check their released video. Wyatt claims that things got a little crazy, and tells Barry that he might not be Bro House material. James says that Barry keeps the whole thing running, but Wyatt continues. Zinn says that they're good friends, and they can't let anything tear them apart. They lose more followers, and Wyatt says that he can't go back to living with his parents. Detective Deana Gibbs from Homicide/Robbery calls and says that she needs to talk to the Bros about Santa. The man hired for the job was someone else, and they found him murdered in his apartment. Gibbs wants the Bros to come down the police station the next morning and give a statement. She wants a copy of the video Barry was recording. The real mall Santa was chopped to pieces and put in a present box.

Wyatt goes out to the garage to get beers. There's a camera taped to the back of the refrigerator interior, and Santa grabs him from behind, beats his heat into the top of the refrigerator, then twists Wyatt's head around 180 degrees on his neck.

Zinn tell James and Barry about Gibbs' call, and how Santa goes around killing mall Santas and taking their places. Barry brings up their video and figures Santa didn't look right, and someone uploads a video of Wyatt's murder to their account. James figures that Wyatt is pranking them, and Zinn goes to talk to Wyatt while Barry deletes the video from their account. Before he can, they get likes. Barry continues deleting it, and tells James that it's sick. However, it gets reposted and Barry doesn't know who. The same person posts a link to a tabloid webpage, with the "truth" about Claus.

Zinn goes out to the garage and the refrigerator rattles. He opens the door but the camera is gone.

Barry reads the article at the link, which says that the legend of Claus is based on tales of the wild man, a pagan nature god who wore animal skins and had a hideous painted face. The wild man was a fierce hunter who punished those who were bad, and Brought more than presents.

Zinn goes outside looking for Wyatt, and finds Santa waiting for him. Santa just stares at Zinn, then takes out an animal thigh bones and beats Zinn down. Barry and James hear Zinn's screams, and Barry figures Zinn and Wyatt are pranking them.

Santa wraps Zinn in the house's Christmas lights and tosses him into the pool, where he's electrocuted. The lights in the house go out, and James wonders if it's Santa. They look out in the pool and see Zinn's body, and James goes to call 911. The police say they're sending a car, and the two Bros go out to their car. A video of Zinn's murders goes to Barry's phone, and they go the front door but hear Santa pounding on the outside, and recorded Christmas songs playing. They hug and go out to their car, and Santa shoots them with candy canes from a crossbow. He pins James' hand to the hood, shoots Barry in the leg, then shoots James in the head.

Barry crawls back in the house and locks the front door behind him. He gets to the fireplace and pulls the cane out of his leg, discovers the phone line is dead, and hears Santa on the roof. Barry's laptop chimes, and he sends out a message begging for help. but everyone thinks that it's a prank. Barry sees ash sifting down from the chimney, and crawls over and tries to close the grate. Santa pours gasoline down, which lands on Barry, and the computer shows the Bro House has hit five million subscribers. Barry is thrilled that they did it, just as Santa tosses a lit match down, setting Barry on fire. Running out to the pool, Barry jumps in but it's too late for him.

The next morning the police and fireman arrive at the house. Gibbs find their Christmas tree decorated with the hacked up parts of the Bros' body.

A mall Santa is leaving his mall, drinks, and gets into his car. Santa is watching from his truck, and chuckles.

description: When another course of IVF fails, a couple turn to unconventional means to conceive.
tags: ['title directed by female', 'pregnancy', 'fertility totem', 'infertility', 'post partum depression']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Dr. Mounds tells Liv Whitley and her husband Matt that the results showing that Liv can't get pregnant, and they should consider adoption or surrogacy. Liv says that she wants to be pregnant, and wants to feel their baby growing inside of her. Matt says that they'll keep trying, and Mound warns that the chances of success decrease with each attempt while the cost increases, and they should be prepared. Asa the couple leaves, Matt tells Liv that they'll keep trying. One he goes, the receptionist Bernadette tells Liv that Matt is a keeper. Bernadette says that she's watch Liv visiting for two years, and shows Liv a Sumerian fertility totem. She tells Liv to place it under her bed during intimacy, and Liv will get a baby. Bernadette says that it's been in her family for a long time, and it's the reason she's there. She assures Liv that she can keep it as long as she likes, and Liv takes it.

That night at home, Liv places the totem beneath her bed. Matt comes to bed and talks about how he gets a better part, and Liv says that she just inherited her money instead of earning it. He says that he's serious about how they'll keep trying, and she stuck with his acting career and he'll stick with her about the baby. They kiss and make love, while it storms outside.

16 Months Later

Liv and her nanny Norma are tending to Liv's baby. The baby is crying despite Liv's efforts to calm him, Matt hasn't gotten back from his current acting job yet, and Norma nanny manages to quiet the baby. Liv complains that she doesn't know how to "operate" her own baby, and says that it's like he doesn't even want to be around her. She snaps, saying that becoming a mother was a mistake.

That night, Liv sees static on the baby monitor, and thinks she hears someone in the house. There's no one there, and she looks under the bed and finds the overturned totem. She takes it out and angrily "thanks" it for everything. and puts it in a box in the closet. Liv coms out and is startled by Matt in a corpse mask. He says that they told him to keep it on, and he has to be back at the set in two hours. Matt tells Liv that Norma called him and wanted him to check on Liv. Liv complains that Matt keeps working at night and isn't concerned about her, He takes off the mask and tells his wife that he doesn't want to live off her money, and Liv feels like she's losing it because she sucks at being a mom. Matt assures her that she doesn't, and that she has the hard job. He tells her that what she's experiencing is completely normal, and says that she should talk to a MD in postpartum disorders.

That night in bed, Liv hears the baby crying over the monitor. She sees a demon on the monitor, standing over the baby's crib, and goes to the nursery. The closet door is open and Liv hears growling from inside. When she looks in, there's nothing there. The monitor tablet in her hand shows the demon standing behind her, but when she turns there's nothing there.

Later, Liv meets with the MD, Eleanor Berger, and tells her what happened. Berger dismisses it as imagination, and Liv says that it's nice talking to someone who has been through the same thing. She wonders if it's possible for a baby to hate its mother, and she can't calm it down but everyone else can. Berger suggests the baby is picking up on Liv's stress, but says that a baby can't hate its mother. However, the MD says that it's not crazy to get that feeling. She suggests that Liv hire a night nurse for a few weeks until Liv's hormones level off, but Liv refuses. Berger agrees but says they can start off with some "new agey" techniques.

Later at home, Liv is giving her baby son, Aaron, a detox bath and talking to him and laughing. She then puts Aaron in his crib and goes out. Matt comes home to find Liv in the kitchen, and she points out on the monitor that Aaron isn't crying anymore and the baths Berger recommended are working. Liv has already made him coffee for his audition, and she thanks him for finding Berger for her. Aaron starts crying, and Liv tells Matt that she's got it, and he should go. Once Matt goes, Liv goes into the nursery and calms down Aaron, and finds the totem in a corner of his crib. It's taken on a more detailed demonic form, and she confirms that it's not where she put it. She asks Norma if she put it in Aaron's crib, and Norma crosses herself and says that she can't work there.

Liv hears growling coming from the basement, and goes downstairs. She finds scratch marks on the wall, and a torn apart duct nearby. A board falls down, scratching her arm with a protruding nail. Liv shows Matt the totem when he comes home, and he says that it looks Satanic. He asks where Liv got it, and she claims she got it at a new age store. Matt figures that a raccoon got caught in the basement, but Liv doesn't believe it and her husband wonders if she's talking about a ghost. He suggests that Liv is very tired and she's imagining things. Liv tells him that he doesn't have to worry about her, and he says that the show wants him back for an actual part. However, they're shooting nights and he can't do it if she's freaking out. Matt wants a reason from her not to worry, and Liv assures him that she's okay.

That night, Liv is in her bed using her laptop to an Internet search on Sumerian totems. She finds photos of the one like she had, and about how they're connected to the demon Ba'al, the Lord of the Flies. She sees Ba'al on the monitor and goes to the nursery, but all that's there is Aaron crying in his crib. She caresses him briefly and then goes out. Listening at the monitor, Liv hears a male voice and records it.

The next morning, Liv plays the recording for Matt. She speeds it up and they hear a voice saying "I want him". Screaming, she tries to make it clearer. Matt brings Berger over and she listens to the recording. She dismisses it as Liv's mind making connection, and says that she doesn't hear anything. Berger insists that Liv isn't thinking clearly because of lack of sleep, and Liv should accept that so she can move forward. The MD proscribes Zoloft, and later Liv takes some.

Matt has his fellow actors and friends from their college film department over for dinner, and they toast his success. One of his friends sees a nearby Ouija board and suggests they try it, and the others agree. Matt is leery, but Liv is with them and says that it's okay. They set up the board and puts their fingers on the planchette. It moves on its own, spelling out "JACK MEHOFF". One of them snickers at his joke, and the planchette moves again,, spelling out "HEISMINE". Liv backs away in terror, saying that "he" means Aaron, and throws the board across the room. She says that there's something in the house, and it wants their son. Matt say that it's crazy, but she says that they need to do something about the demon and runs out of the room. She goes to the nursery with Matt following her, complaining that she embarrassed her in front of his friends. Matt says he can't deal with her depression anymore, and tells her to do what she has to do but figure her shit out. Liv curses him and goes to the nursery, comforting Aaron who is crying, apparently because of the storm outside. She sees Ba'al outside the window, and tells him that he'll never get her baby.

Later, Bernadette goes to her car in the fertility clinic's parking garage. Liv approaches her with the totem and says that now Ba'al wants the baby back, She wants Bernadette to tell her how to get rid of Ba'al. Bernadette takes Liv to her apartment and says that Ba'al is a fertility god, not a demon, and one of her collected grimoires has a banishment spell. She says that her parents dabbled in the sacred arts, and she's been into paganism since it turned her life around from drug use. Bernadette insists that she only gave Liv the totem to help, and finds the banishment spell. She gives Liv a ritual dagger she bought and tells Liv to follow the ritual.

That night at her home, Liv performs the ritual, dribbling her blood on the totem while chanting. When Matt comes up behind her, a startled Liv stabs the dagger into his chest.

Two Weeks Later

Liv is in a sanitarium, and Matt comes to see her. They hug and apologizes for stabbing him, and he tells her that she didn't mean to do it and it's in the past. Matt says that Aaron is good, and tells Liv that she doesn't have to stay there. Liv says that she's not coming home until Berger says that it's safe, and won't leave until she gets a handle on everything. Matt tells her that he's there for her, and he loves her.

Matt goes to his car where Bernadette is waiting inside, and they kiss. He tells her that once his lawyers get done with, he'll have Liv committed for good. Bernadette is glad to get rid of the fake occult books. Later, Matt and Bernadette have a party with all their friends, who were in on it and set up the whole Ouija board scene. Matt's friends set up all the sound effects and scratches, one of them wore a Ba'al costume, and substituted her Zoloft for psychoactives. Matt says that when all of Liv's money is his, he'll pay them off. Aaron starts crying, and Matt says that he deliberately made himself infertile bur still impregnated Liv.

Matt goes to check on Aaron, while the lights flicker in the room where the others are. The friends hear growling, and fog pours into the room. Ba'al appears and kills all of them. Matt hears them screaming, goes to the room, and finds their corpses and Ba'al killing Bernadette.

Later, Matt is locked up as a murderer. Liv comes to see him and says that he's a bastard. Matt told the police everything, and he didn't want kids but Liv didn't listen. He wanted her money, and he insists that he didn't kill his friends for the money even though the police think he did. Matt insists that it was Ba'al, and Liv tells him that she's not going to listen to it from him He begs Liv for his help, and needs money for an attorney. Liv refuses to help him, says that Aaron doesn't have a father, and walks out.

Back at home, Liv holds Aaron and says that it's the two of them against the world. Ba'al appears and tells Liv to release him now that he's killed the others. Liv says that Bernadette gave her a real banishing spell even though Bernadette didn't believe it, and Liv cast it in the hospital. She summoned Ba'al and sent him to kill Matt' friend and frame Matt.

Liv agrees to release Ba'al as long as he gives her another son.

description: A family goes on a camping trip unaware of what is lurking in the woods.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Jay and Addy Gantz, and their son Jacob, drive into the woods for a camping trip. When Jay insists on calling his law firm to check in, Addy reminds him that they had agreed that work was off-limits during their trip. He says that it's about experiencing nature, and getting outside of their comfort zones. Jacob says that he's rather have TV then go camping.

The family enters Kern Canyon National Park and drives back into the wood. They pull to a lake and Jay sets the camp up. That night, Addy puts Jacob to bed while Jay relaxes and drinks, unaware that someone is watching the campsite from the nearby woods.

Once Jacob falls asleep, Jay and Addy go into the son and look at their sleeping son. They kiss, and then hear something howling in the distance. Jay dismisses it and they make love, while a shadow of something passes by outside.

The next morning, Jay gives Jacob his old Boy Scour compass before the two of them go fishing. Back at the camp, Addy comes out of the latrine tent and sees a trail of blood on the ground. She follows it into the forest and finds a dead deer hanging in a tree. Meanwhile, Jacob runs ahead of his father, going out of sight. Jay discovers that his son has vanished Addy runs up and Jay tells her what happened, and the panicked parents look for their son.

Ten Years Later

A drunken Jay has passed out from drinking while looking at clippings about his son's disappearance. Someone pounds on the door, waking him up, and he answers it. A man, Bob Birch, is there and says that they need to talk. Birch says that he has information about Jacob, and Jay lets Birch in. Jay explains that people think he killed Jacob, and make threatening phone calls and slash his tires. Birch says that he's a hunter leading tours into the woods, and that he's an eyewitness. He shows Jay a photo from a photo trap he hung up, and he found the compass nearby. The photo shows a boy about the same age that Jacob would be after ten years, and Birch explains that the part of the park where Jacob has been overrun by some of the cartel farms, and some of the cartel members abduct people as leverage. The photo was snapped where they operate, and Birth offers to take Jay there in return for expenses and nothing more. He says that Jay will have to talk to the growers separately.

Jay goes to see Addy and tells her what Birch told him. She figures that Birch is fishing for money and it's a scam, and Addy won't look at the photo again, for fear of the hope she has and is crushed each time they find a possible clue but it turns out to go nowhere. Addy tells him to find something to do, and that she can't teach anymore, and insists that Jacob is gone for good. Jay shows her the compass, and says that he can't ignore it but he doesn't have the money. Addy curses him and goes to get the money.

At the park, Birch takes Addy and Jay to the Malvados area of the park, where the camera snapped the photo, and says that they need to be at the growers' camp before sunset. Birch leads them through the forest to the camp, Jay asks what Rob thinks of what's happened, and Addy tells him that she and Rob split up. He says that he wanted to catch up with Addy, and she says that Rob wanted to start a family but she didn't want another. Jay tells her that she implied that she wanted their divorce, and she insists that she never blamed Jay for Jacob's disappearance. He needed to believe that she did. Birch comes over and tells them to work out their problem later, and they need to keep moving. They continue into the word, and someone watches them from hiding.

Birch tells them that a ranger's station ahead, but the ranger who runs it is fucked up and they should avoid conversation. Birch goes in with Jay, while Addy stays behind to get water from a pump. Jay thinks he's something out in the forest, but dismisses it as nothing. Meanwhile the ranger, Stan Vogel, approaches Addy and asks which way her group is heading. Jay and Birch come over, and Addy says that they're just getting out of the city. Vogel recognizes Birch, who says that he's running another tour. Vogel doesn't believe them and Jay agrees, and says that they're there to find their son. The ranger says that he recognizes them from the news, and Jay says that they believe Jacob is alive and they're heading up into the Malvados.

Vogel says that the Malvados is nowhere to go, and there are things there a million times worse than the growers. Addy asks for more details, and Vogel says that he had only been in the country a couple of months, and was at the station when Jacob went missing. He saw footprints around the station, and something apparently attacked him and then walked off, carrying something. Jay tells Addy that they can't buy into it, and Birch says that they either move immediately or lose the sun. Vogel tells Addy to go back the way she came.

The group continues on, and Addy mentions the deer she found hanging from the tree just before Jacob disappeared. Birch says that in the 20+ years he's been hunting in the park, he's never seen anything he can't explain. When Birch says that Addy is nuts for believing Vogel's claim, Jay tells the hunter not to talk to his ex-wife like that and walks past Birch.

Vogel is at the ranger station watching the woods through binoculars. He hears screeching in the distance and goes into the station to get his shotgun.

The group comes to dead men and women. Birch draws his pistol and says that it must be a rival cartel, and Addy wonders if there's anyone else who can help them. The hunter laughs and says that he doesn't know where Jacob is, and the photo he showed them was of his nephew, in his backyard. He bought the compass at a Salvation Army store, and he says that he needed their money, and made a deal with the cartel that he'd get $100 and they'd make the couple disappear and get their credit cards. Birch would go back and say that the couple got lost in the woods. The hunter says that he can't just let them walk out of the woods, and tells them to get down on their knees. The couple refuses, and Birch prepares to shoot them anyway. One of the "corpses" opens his eyes and rips Birch's throat out with his teeth, and Birch's gun goes off, taking Jay in the side The Gantzs pick up the gun and Addy helps Jacob away. Meanwhile, the feral feeds on Birch's body, and more ferals emerge from the woods and eat the still-living Birch.

That night, the couple get back to the station, and Vogel takes them inside. Addy tells the ranger that Birch is dead, and Vogel tends to Jay's wound. Vogel has Addy tell him what happened, and Vogel says that the ferals weren't afraid of the gun. He goes to the window and says that he's not allowed to tell them what the ferals are. Jay aims the gun at Vogel and demands answers, and has Addy get Vogel's shotgun.

Vogel takes a file folder out of a cabinet and says that the national park system was created to keep Americans from things that would kill and eat them. He explains that the ferals are a subpopulation of humans that live in the deep woods like animals, and were sometimes known as "wild men". Whenever they can, the ferals go cannibal. They've been inbreeding, and might be descended from mountain men or Confederate soldiers who never surrendered. There are pockets of ferals in every national park. The government needs its citizens to believe they're in control, and the parks generate billions in revenue that the government can't risk losing. Addy remembers being soldiers sent in the day Jacob went missing, and went into the woods and never came out. Vogel says that they were on their own mission, to kill as many ferals as possible for "population control". The ranger was sent in with them because he knew the area, and the ferals killed the soldiers.

The ranger asks for his gun back, and Jay gives it to him. He says that he'll call on the radio to get Jay to a hospital, and warns that the ferals are moving into areas they're not supposed to be. It's his duty to call in for another sweep, and says that if the Gantzs go public with what he's told them, he'll deny it.

Vogel warms up the radio and tries to call for help. Meanwhile, Jay tells Addy that she was right and he was wrong, and almost got them killed. Addy tells Jay that at least they know what happened, and Jay figures it would have been better not to know. He apologizes for everything, and says he wanted her to blame him so he could punish himself, so he destroyed the best thing he ever had: them. Vogel gets through to his people and says that they have a situation, and then a feral on the ceiling leaps down and attacks him. More ferals break in through the window and Jay shoots one with the gun. More come in and Jay discovers that he's out of bullets. The ferals tear Vogel apart and eat his intestines, and Jay and Addy climb out the window and Jay limps through the forest with Addy helping him.

The ferals chase the couple, and as they reach a clearing more ferals surround them and then stop. A teenage is in front of the couple, seated on a throne of bones. The real compass is hanging around his neck, and the Gantzs realize that it's Jacob. Addy calls to him, using his name, and he vaguely says "Boo" like he did when playing hide and seek with Jay ten years ago.

A tall feral approaches and asks who the couple is. Jacob says that they're dinner, and the ferals descend on the couple and eat them alive. Their blood lands on Jacob, who licks it.

description: A couple dares to spend a night in one of the most infamous haunted houses.
tags: ['title directed by female']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A couple, Dylan and Connie, pull up to the Murder House and they tell the Uber driver that they're deliberately going in, even though they know it's the most haunted house in LA. The couple know all about haunted house in the US, and tell the driver that they're huge American Horror Story fans. They've rented the house for the night, and Dylan explains that the owners run a whole "Escape from the Murder House" experience, and he and Connie met at Comic-Con dressed as characters from the show.

The couple go inside and Connie takes in the energy of the house. She gasps, and then dismisses it as nothing. The couple explore the house, and find a card telling them to find the room where Tate first appeared to "her" and they consummated their love. They follow the black rose petal trail laid down by the owners they go to the bedroom and find dozens of candles lit, and Dylan reveals he's wearing a shirt like Tate's. The couple make out on the bed and afterward, Dylan smokes and they talk about why people like scary stories so much. They hear a child's voice saying they're going to die in the house, and figure the voice is coming from a hidden speaker.

A red ball rolls into the room and the couple go to investigate. Connie can't get up from the bed, and Dylan finally pulls her up after making an effort. They find the corpse of a nurse at the base of the stairs, and the nurse gets up and walks away. The couple follow her to the basement, and Dylan tells Connie that it's their last chance to back out. They both refuse and go into the basement, and go into a room and hear a child crying. They find three girls in a cell, who beg the couple for help. The couple have no idea who the girls are. The girls say that they came there ten years ago on Halloween, and Ben Harmon greets them at the door and told them to leave. The girls came in to give Ben a Rubber Man and Piggy Man stab them from behind.

One of the girls points out that if someone is killed in Murder House, they can never leave. Connie agrees, but Dylan figures that it's part of the experience. The Infantata dashes past, cutting Dylan as it passes. Connie yells that they want it to stop, and Rubber Man appears in the cell and kills the girls. Connie yells that she wants the owners to stop, and one of the girls calls through the bars, saying that it's real. The couple runs, and the Infantata pulls Connie down. Dylan kicks it off Connie and pulls her up the stairs, but Addie is waiting and shoots Dylan dead. She tells Connie that they've come for the couple's deaths, and Connie manages to shove past her. The other ghosts appear and one of them slashes Connie across the arm. She shoves him over the banister and runs up, but Twisty beats her to death with a juggling a club.

The game ends, declaring the Connie avatar dead. The teenage player, Rory, complains that the controls are glitched, and his mother Michelle asks that that's fixed but what does he think of the game in general. Rory tells his mother that characters from wrong seasons are in the House, and that people trapped in the house are trapped by their own personality flaws. Michelle says that she put everything they had financially into making the game, and she needs it to work out for their family. Rory tells her that she could have just watched the show with him, and Michelle doesn't get the vibe of the show. Michelle insists that she's trying, and Rory goes to stay at his father's., and might stay there for a couple of weeks because things have gotten weird there.

Michelle binges 'American Horror Story' on streaming and takes notes, Later, Michelle goes to the house and the real estate agent, Tim Williams, admits that the bodies of nine murder victims were found there. Michelle tells him that he knows, and gets it at for a much lower price because the bank can't sell it otherwise. Meanwhile, Michelle whispers to herself that she's going to make the House reveal all its secrets to her

On Halloween, Michelle goes to her ex-husband Steven's house and admires Rory's costume when he come to the door. She says that she brought him clothes because she's going away to a writers' convention for a week and find out more about American Horror Story. Steven comes to the door and he sarcastically says that when she goes broke, he has to pay for Rory. He tells Michelle that she's on one of her obsessions again, and she says that since they're not married she can do without his opinion. Steven continues anyway, telling Michelle that she's got a chip on her shoulder, and she's kill herself to prove that she's right. Michelle talks to Rory privately and says the trip will be the answer to all their worries. Rory tells her that she has nothing to prove to him, but Michelle kisses him and says that she's going.

Michelle drives to the House, and two red-headed boys run up to her and says that she's going to die in the house, and run off. The various ghosts walk out of the house and into the night, passing Michelle. As Maya walks by with her friends, she tells Michelle not go in because it's already crowded.

Ruby is at the door, and Michelle wonders if they're all superfans. Scarlett arrives, and Ruby asks her to come in for a bit. Michelle goes after them and they disappear, and Michelle calls out saying that she's the new owner. She walks through the house and upstairs, and says that she's making a game based on the House.

Scarlett is in the tub, and Ruby comes up from the water. Her lover asks Ruby do if she could escape the house and put her soul to rest for good, would she do it. Ruby says that she wouldn't now that she's met Scarlett, Scarlett doesn't care if the others are freed, including her dads, and the two women kiss. Scarlett says that her days are spent in working at a dead-end job and watching TV, waiting for Halloween so she be with Ruby on Halloween. Ruby says that they should go cause some trouble.

Michelle sits in the kitchen, and a red ball rolls across the floor to her feet. She follows it back to where it came from and finds Ben sitting in his office, crying. He apologizes for sobbing and recognizes Michelle. She says that she'll never close the deal, and just needed a way in. Michelle explains that she's trying to get inspiration for her video game. When Ben talks about counseling against violent video games, Michelle realizes who he is and he says that he's there paying for his sins like everyone else trapped there. Michelle figures that he's playing a joke on her, and Ben assures her that it's no joke. When he blames the women in his life for cheating, Michelle sits down across from him and he has to take personal responsibility for his own actions.

Ben explains that he thought he could have a family, and a life away from them. He ended up in the House with nothing. He figures Michelle is judging him because Steven cheated on her, and Michelle explains that Steven was faithful and she's judging Ben because she can. Michelle talks about the problems in her former marriage, and how she eventually gets bored and then hurtful. Ben understands, and Michelle asks him what the House is like. She asks what's the point of the House is, and Ben tells her that there is no point and it's dull. Michelle tells Ben that Rory thinks people are trapped there because they never resolved their issues when they were alive, and suggests that the point is that people have to learn and grow. Ben doesn't think much of her idea, and says he tried that with Tate after Ben got stuck there, and it didn't work.

Michelle asks to speak to somebody who isn't so lost and hopeless. Ben tells her that there's nobody like that in the House, walks out, and disappears. Ruby and Scarlett come up to Michelle, Scarlett in the rubber suit. Michelle says that she can't get a vibe for the house and will make a game about something else. Ruby tells her that most of the spirits have no interest in growth, and the only thing they like more than being stuck in their own misery is being stuck there with someone even more miserable. All they need is more souls to feed the suffering.

Rubber Man appears behind the women, while Ben comes up to Michelle and tells her to run. Rubber Man kills Ben as he takes Michelle to the door, and Scarlett kills Michelle.

One Year Later: Halloween

Michelle goes to Steven's house and greets Rory as he comes out. They hug and then Rory assumes she's an impostor. Michelle says that they have one night together, and apologizes for lying and saying she was going to a convention. Rory figures she didn't tell him because she didn't want him to stop her, and once they got calls about her failing to buy the House, he knew her obsession had killed her. His mother says that she just wanted to make Rory proud, and he tells her that she could have impressed him if she had gone to a psychiatrist and dealt with her issues. Michelle says that she's stuck and there's no escaping Murder House. Rory says that he thinks there is, and she needs to burn it to the ground. She says that if it works, she never sees him again. He tells her that she was gone from him a long time ago, and it's time for all of the misery of the House to end. Michelle says that there are good people in the house, and makes her son promise that he won't do anything to the House. Rory then tells her that he isn't dressed up because he doesn't like Halloween anymore, and rides off on his bicycle.

The ghosts return to the House, and Scarlett and Ruby say their goodbyes for another year. They kiss and then Ruby disappears into the House as the sun rises. She's in one of the windows, and waves goodbye to Scarlett and Scarlett waves back and then walks away. Rory walks up to the House with a wheelbarrow filled with gas cans.

Ruby is running water in the tub, and looks out the window to see Rory pouring gas onto the lawn. Michelle joins her and says that Rory is her son, and he's trying to burn down the House. She says that Rory believes burning down the House will free the spirits, and hopes it will. Ruby asks what happens to those of them that don't want to be free, and goes out to confront Rory. Dr. Grant comes up to Michelle and tells her that she and Rory should consider family therapy. Michelle pushes past Grant and goes out.

Ruby goes down the stairs and prepares to gut Rory, making sure he dies outside the property. Ben, Maya and the other girls grab Ruby and say that they want to be free, and they all stab Ruby. He then goes over to Ruby and cuts her throat, and he and the girls go to the window to watch Rory. The dying Ruby calls Scarlett for help, and Scarlett drives back to the House.

Michelle goes out and asks Rory if he's sure it's what he wants, and he says that he does. She says that the video game will be a seller, and Rory takes out matches and tells his mother goodbye. Ruby stabs Michelle repeatedly, and Michelle yells at Rory to light the House up. Ruby advances on Rory, who can't get the matches to light. Ben and the girls grab Ruby and drag her back, and Scarlett arrives and grabs Rory's wrist, and begs him to stop. Ben and Michelle yell at Rory to do it, and he lights a match and drops into the gasoline. It ignores and the flames consume the House, the blast knocking Rory and Scarlett back. Ruby calls to Scarlett to die with her, and Michelle waves goodbye to Rory. Scarlett mouths to Ruby that she can't, and Ruby goes into the House with the others.

Later, Rory and Steven watch the news about the House burning down. Rory smiles in satisfaction.

Three Years Later

Scarlett drives to a condo built where the House stood, and Tim shows her around. When he tries to put a good face on it, she asks if he tells people that the House once stood there. Tim says that he used to, but nobody in the first six months has been harmed or seen any spirits. He figures that the fire purified whatever occult forces were contained in the House, and the spirits are finally free. Scarlett confirms that it's the last unit and says that she'll take it and pay the $1 million in cash. Tim asks where she got the money, and Scarlett says that she became a hired assassin, and is now semiretired. The realtor takes the news in stride and says that he'll draw up the papers.

Later, Scarlett moves in. She lights candles in the bathroom and looks at herself in the mirror. Scarlett gets into the filled bathtub and calls to Ruby, saying that she's there and ready to be with her forever. She figures that she's too late and Ruby is gone forever. Scarlett then goes to bed, and Ruby appears besides her. They hug and Ruby says that the others chose to move on and are gone. Ruby was the only one who wanted to stay, for Scarlett, and she knew her lover would come back for her. Scarlett says that true love never dies and they kiss.

Rory is playing the 'Escape From Murder House' video game, and it ends with Scarlett and Ruby reunited. Michelle asks him if the game gets the vibe, and he tells his mother that it's so much better. Rory says that he likes it and it's super cool, and he's proud of his mother. Michelle thanks him and they go to get something to eat. As they go, Rory asks Michelle where he thinks all the trapped spirits went. She figures that the one who wanted to stay stayed, and the ones who wanted to move on moved on. Michelle hopes that none of them escaped into the world.

Once they leave, the red ball rolls across the floor.
