description: Emily gets to work on her next target, a former family friend who testified against her father. Victoria tries to find more information on Emily.
tags: ['beating', 'father son relationship', 'abuse', 'jealousy', 'false identity', 'bully', 'adolescent']
synopsis_with_character_names:
12 WEEKS EARLIER:

Emily is at a polo match checking out Daniel who is playing in the match. Ashley comes over and talks her through the major players in the room, a list that includes Victoria and Conrad Grayson.

Cut to Declan Porter sitting at his father's bar texting with Charlotte Grayson, who is bored at the polo match. Declan's father Carl (Brian Goodman) gets a phone call that seems to be bad news. Declan asks if Charlie wants to go on a boat ride.

Charlotte is with Adam (Robbie Amell), who takes note of her activity.

Daniel is not playing well in the match, much to the disappointment of his parents. An associate of Conrad's named Bill Harmon (Matthew Glave) wants to bet against Daniel and makes a few cracks about him. Bill and Victoria exchange subtle barbs before Emily walks over. She tells them that she has a strong offer down on Lydia's home. Conrad ignores a call from Lydia and Victoria notices.

Jack calls Nolan Ross, who had previously made an offer on his boat, and says he'll sell. Nolan says he'll buy it.

Bill and Emily discuss money. He thinks she should get her money into the market and they make arrangements to meet. Emily flashes to the memory that Bill was one of her father's closest friends, and one the people to testify against him.

At the match's halftime, Daniel asks Emily out on a date. She agrees, provided his team (which she has bet on) wins.

Conrad's head of security Frank Stevens (Max Martini) gives Victoria his guesses about Emily. Upon direct questioning, he admits to being aware of Conrad's affair.

After making the purchase Nolan tells Jack he doesn't know how to sail. He says that what he actually wants is for Jack to be his hang-out friend all summer.

Charlotte brings a few of her rich pals to see Declan at the bar. With the place empty Adam grabs one of the liquor bottles. Declan, outnumbered and intimidated, gives them the thumbs up. They head to the dock and Declan sees the boat is gone. Charlotte and her friends leave.

While reading a letter from her father, Emily flashes back to hearing Bill tell her father he's in trouble. She watches a video of Bill testifying that David was guilty of what he had done, including connecting him to terrorist organizations. Victoria calls to invite Emily over for tea.

At his office, Bill pitches Emily about the virtues of investing with his company. He shows her evidence of the success he's had recently with his top-tier investors, even revealing a list of what seem to be prominent names. She appears to be taking careful mental notes.

In the city, Lydia (Amber Valletta) meets Conrad in his limo and tells him that photographic evidence of their affair has surfaced and cost her millions in the divorce settlement. She wants him to write her a check.

Emily gets a call that the beach house was sold to somebody else.

Jack tells Declan that their father is broke and he sold the boat to help save the business. Their father overhears and makes it clear that he doesn't like that his son is trying to bail him out. Jack assures his father that they'll get through this crisis.

Later Nolan gets into his car, only to find Emily in the backseat. Emily reminds Nolan that she warned him not to get in her way and demands to know why he bought her beach house out from under her. He tells Emily that Victoria attempted to out-bid her for the house, but he ended up out-bidding Victoria. He is grateful to her father for giving him his start and has already put the deed to the house in her name.

"Consider it a birthday gift for Amanda," Nolan says. "Tomorrow is the big day, isn't it?"

Over tea, Victoria politely does some serious prying into Emily's background, which Emily gamely handles. Emily reveals that she's obsessed with history and is passionate about art conservation, which is why she joined New York's Landmark Preservation Society.

"My father always said that our past defines who we are", Emily says.

Victoria explained her own belief: "I would say it's our choices that define us".

"Maybe for the lucky," Emily replies, "but sometimes in life we're not given a choice."

Daniel walks in during this conversation, sweaty from a workout. Emily politely excuses herself, saying that closing the deal on the beach house had gotten quite aggressive. Victoria faux-pleasantly offers a toney "quel dommage" and asks if she'll be renting a fall-back property, or heading back to the city.

When Emily replies that she just received a notification that she got the beach house on her phone, Victoria looks visibly upset.

Just before a meeting with Bill, Emily makes sure he sees her hugging Nolan.

During their meeting Bill congratulates Emily for investing with his "family." She tells him she want to get involved with a Chinese cell phone manufacturer, saying that "a little bird" may have given her inside information. She'll wire him money later that day.

Daniel calls Emily to say he's got a surprise for her that night. Ashley is in on it.

On TV we see an investment reporter report that the Chinese company Emily mentioned to Bill is about to partner with Nolan's company. Bill calls her to ask about the information she gave him, and she says she wants to double her investment. After hanging up Bill immediately tells an assistant they are going "all-in" on the cell phone company.

At this point Nolan is interviewed on TV, saying that rumors of the partnership were misguided and he is instead getting involved with the chief competitor of the company Emily directed Bill towards. Bill tells his team to say nothing to their investors about what just happened. Cut to Emily calling everybody on the list of Bill's largest investors to tell them what happened.

Frank brings Victoria evidence that appears to suggest Emily had an affair with Lydia's husband: Both are members of New York's Landmark Preservation Society, and both of their names disappeared from the meeting's list of attendees at the same time.

Bill's assistant tells him they are "finished."

Jack is ignoring Nolan. Nolan presents another offer: If they hang out all summer he'll give him back the boat at the end of the season.

With Charlotte in another room. Adam sees a text from Declan about hanging out that night at the bar. He responds for her with: "UR on big guy . . . wear something sexy!"

Emily and Daniel take a stroll on the beach. She tells him that both of her parents died when she was a kid. He walks her to the front door of her new place. Their first kiss is interrupted by a late-arriving Nolan and Jack. All of her friends are inside, there to celebrate with her.

At the party Nolan asks Emily why she bet on the wrong company and she tells him about her plan to ruin Bill. He smiles.

Declan waits alone at the bar, expecting Charlotte. Instead Adam and his friends show up and savagely rough him up. Declan puts up a fight but is out-numbered.

Jack is happy Emily doesn't plan to change the home. He makes reference to the home's history.

Declan's father breaks up his son's beating and sends the rich kids running. Upset about his place in life Declan says to his father, "I'm a loser, just like you."

Frank finds that there is a gap in Emily's record from age 16 to 18. Victoria wants him look even closer.

Emily and Daniel have a long kiss on the porch before he says good night. Victoria seems to see this from her window next door.

In her voiceover narration, Emily observes that trust is a difficult thing.

As Emily writes a red X over Bill's face in the Grayson Corporation photo, we see a flashback of her breaking into Bill's office to pull the investor list from his computer.

As Emily stares at an old photo of her and Jack, we see Jack getting home to find his father lying on the floor and not breathing.

Her voiceover then observes that trusting your heart is the riskiest thing of all, as we see Conrad and Victoria getting in bed for the night, Victoria lying awake with a look of concern on her face.

We then flashback to young Emily seeing that her father was having an affair with Victoria. Her father tells Victoria that Bill Harmon knows and may be planning to tell Victoria's husband. "I trusted the wrong person," Emily's father admits.

In the present, Emily lights a birthday candle on a small cupcake. "In the end," her narration concludes, "the only person we can truly trust is ourself."

"Happy birthday, Amanda," Emily whispers forlornly, before blowing out the candle.

description: Emily seeks to destroy the district attorney who convicted her father. Victoria tries to confirm her suspicions about Emily's past.
tags: ['betrayal', 'public humiliation', 'party', 'rascal', 'father son relationship', 'blackmail', 'ritual', 'brother brother relationship', 'embarrassment', 'father figure', 'adolescent']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Emily dreams that Victoria discovers who she is and what she is up to. She hears a noise, awakens and gets out her gun. It's just a dog.

Victoria makes a call inquiring about Emily and a board she was on with Lydia's ex-husband. Conrad got Victoria a necklace.

Jack and Declan's father has passed away. Declan is still beating himself up for calling his dad a loser during their last conversation.

Jack tells Emily about his father passing away.

The Graysons are hosting a fundraiser to kick-off the re-election campaign of a Senator Tom Kingsly. Emily arrives late and Kingsly (Yancey Arias), to Victoria's surprise, is immediately glad to see her. The senator knows Emily from her volunteering on his first campaign. We see Emily flash back to the courtroom and Kingsly, then a Federal prosecutor, ruthlessly cross-examining her father.

Emily watches more old footage from when Kingsly was the prosecutor who put her father away. The case jump-started his career. She calls Nolan and asks for help with a Power Point presentation.

Victoria tells Conrad she doesn't like Kingsly and isn't happy he's in their house. She makes a reference to his infidelity.

Daniel picks up Emily for a date and, snooping a bit, finds her gun. He suggests they go shooting sometime.

Nolan drops by the wake for Jack's father. Nolan asks Declan about his bruises and mentions there are many ways to get even with people who wrong you.

During dinner Kingsly's wife Diane (Nicole Pulliam) compliments Victoria's necklace. Kingsly gets notice of a private E-mail and steps away from the table with an aide. The E-mail has an embedded video of Kingsly. He is upset and asks his aide to look into it.

During dinner Emily excuses herself. She asks a waiter to bring a steak knife to her table. When he brings it is clear the man, Patrick, has a history with Daniel. We see that Emily had her knife and set the whole thing up. Out in the parking lot Patrick begins smashing the windshield of Daniel's car with a golf club. He tells Daniel that if he was a man he would apologize to his sister.

Another video of Kingsly is sent. This one has him with a woman. Victoria walks in and they lie to her about what is being discussed. Victoria flashes back to visiting Kingsly during jury deliberation at David Clarke's trial to tell him Emily's father is innocent. Conrad walked in and told Kingsly that his wife had fallen in love with Clark.

Daniel tells Emily that he dated Patrick's sister Sarah. He left a party drunk and got in an accident. She is in rehab for a spinal cord injury and his parents paid off her and the judge. She thinks he should own up to his mistake.

Kingsly tells Conrad and Frank that his affair ended in amicably several months ago. He doesn't think the woman could be behind this. Kingsly said that he paid for her to terminate the pregnancy. Since he is a Conservative politician, his hypocrisy and resulting scandal would ruin both his marriage and his political career.

Declan drives a drunken Nolan home. He wants to know about how to get even with Adam. Nolan jumps on his computer and accesses Adam's private web cam.

Emily reads in her father's diary that Victoria told him before the deliberation that she'd help get him free. He didn't know why that never happened. Emily watches video of Kingsly with his mistress.

Daniel's Harvard room mate Tyler stops by. He seems smitten with Ashley.

Jack is going to scatter their father's ashes. Declan still doesn't want to participate and Jack can't change his mind.

Frank tells Victoria that Daniel went to see Sarah in rehab. Emily drove him. Victoria thinks Emily is the reason Lydia's husband left her, which she plans on proving that night at the fundraiser.

Nolan sends a secret file to Kingsly's tablet that should turn a Power Point presentation when he opens it to accompany his announcement speech.

Tyler is looking for an internship and needs to crash for a while. Victoria talks to Daniel about seeing Sarah. He went to apologize and she wasn't forgiving. She tells her son to take it slow with Emily "until we know more about her."

Ashley asks Emily about Tyler. She seems interested. Adam calls Charlotte and says he's not into politics. He tells her to call him when it's over. We see that he has another girl, in her underwear, in his room.

Declan sees on the laptop he got from Nolan that Adam is cheating on Charlotte.

When Emily says she didn't say anything about Sarah to his mother, Daniel guesses his mother is having him followed. He says no matter what happens he'll always be honest with her. She kisses him.

Lydia's ex-husband Michael arrives. Victoria seems anxious to show that Emily is there but is disappointed that not only is their meeting pleasant but Emily was the person who introduced Michael to his current date.

Conrad introduces "my friend" Senator Kingsly. When he begins his speech there is a note on his tablet telling him to look for the red dress. Kingsly spots his former lover Erin (Kim Swennen), who is clearly pregnant. Kingsly then awkwardly tell the crowd he is not seeking re-election and is retiring from public life. Emily looks very pleased.

In a back room we learn that the mistress has been communicating with someone she believed to be Kingsly for a month. This person sent her money, gave her the dress and invited her to the function.

Emily leaves Daniel to hang out with Tyler.

Emily says good night to Victoria, and asks her if she can start calling her Victoria instead of Mrs. Grayson. She says yes.

Emily finds Nolan waiting on her porch. She tells him she got the footage by buying the building the mistress lived in and installing cameras. She says that she's still going to release the footage to the press because she wanted to ruin his life as well as his career.

Charlotte sends Adam a text wondering where he is. She opens her laptop and finds an E-mail from Declan. It's video of him in front of a sunset saying he misses her.

Emily goes to see Jack on his boat. He has his father's ashes and is going to spread them by himself. Emily notices that the boat is named Amanda (her real name). Jack says the dog named the boat.

Frank tells Conrad that the IP address attached to the videos of Kingsly was his own computer. They assume Victoria is to blame.

We see Victoria flashing back to cuddling in bed with David. He gives her earrings and makes her promise to think of him when she wears them. Victoria has tears in her eyes.

description: Emily targets the psychiatrist responsible for institutionalizing her as a child. Declan and Jack face a tough decision.
tags: ['deception', 'therapy', 'infidelity', 'friendship', 'friend', 'sex', 'best friend', 'mother daughter relationship', 'blackmail', 'childhood sweetheart', 'dog', 'disappearance', 'billionaire', 'website', 'terrorist', 'hidden camera', 'back stabbing', 'college roommate', 'billiards', 'child psychologist', 'therapist', 'drinking', 'towel', 'party', 'brother brother relationship', 'bed', 'bare chested male']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Emily is in a counseling session with her therapist, Dr. Banks. She's talking about her parents being killed in a car crash. Her problem seems to be that she is unable to move past that early childhood trauma and have healthy relationships. She's been seeing Banks for a year. After she leaves we see Banks videotapes these sessions for her notes.

Conrad accuses Victoria of being behind the takedown of Kingsly. She reminds him how many people dislike him and the fact he leaves his laptop lying around. He's packing for a trip. There is a mother-daughter tea coming up that Victoria wants Charlotte to attend. She's not excited.

After a tennis match Daniel and Emily say they can't join Tyler and Ashley for a night on the town because they have a date. Tyler seems disappointed that Daniel wants to spend so much time with his new girlfriend.

Jack brings back the contents of their father's safety deposit box. It has the first dollar he ever made and their mother's wedding ring. Jack is trying to decide whether to sell the bar or not.

Victoria is also one of Banks's patients. We see that Emily is able to access Banks's private session videos. She flashes back to childhood and Banks, in an institutional setting, is not letting the young Amanda see her father. Banks is clearly her next target.

Ashley is making a video to be shown at Victoria's tea. It is a charitable fundraiser and Banks will be speaking. Emily mentions to Victoria that she is one of Banks's patients.

Emily stops by Daniel's to ask him what kind of food he wants to have for dinner that night. Tyler tells her he's not around and the conversation seems a little awkward. When she leaves we see that Daniel was actually in the shower. Tyler lies to Daniel, telling him that Emily cancelled their date. He then hides Daniel's cell phone.

Jack and Nolan discuss his father's life insurance and the possible sale of the bar. Emily stops by and says hello. Jack is considering using money from the sale to leave the country permanently.

Declan stops by to see Charlotte as she waits to be fitted for a dress for the tea. He shows her his mother's wedding ring, saying he's going to get it appraised. Victoria doesn't seem thrilled that Charlotte is speaking to Declan.

Daniel doesn't show for their dinner and Emily is calling him trying to find out where he is. Jack drops by to thank her for bringing his dog back to him. Since she's been stood up, Emily invites him in to share a bottle of wine. Jack says he's not going to decide about the bar until the end of the season because he's looking for a reason to stick around. Daniel shows up at the front door and sees them together through the window, seemingly enjoying dinner and drinks together.

At the tea Ashley can't find the DVD she made. Emily stops by and quickly "finds" it. Nolan drops by and Emily warns him not to involve Jack. He references "retribution" being in the air.

When Daniel talks about Emily seeing another guy Tyler quickly moves in with the peer pressure. He pulls out a bottle of booze and convinces Daniel to start drinking now that he is newly single.

Conrad is visiting Lydia. They discuss Kingsly and Victoria inviting Lydia's ex to the dinner.

Banks's speech begins and the video starts. After a few seconds we begin to see some of the most private confessions of Banks's patients. Emily is included, as is Victoria talking about wondering sometimes if having a second child (Charlotte) was a mistake. Charlotte leaves and Victoria accuses Banks of being behind all of this, saying she will ruin her.

Victoria tells Frank that Banks knows "too much." He starts working on helping her. Victoria flashes back to Banks deciding whether or not to institutionalize Amanda. Victoria offered Banks her own private practice in return for Amanda never seeing her father again.

Jack tells Declan he's not selling the bar just yet. A very drunk Daniel shows up with Tyler at the bar.

Nolan is waiting for Emily at her place to congratulate her on the genius of the takedown of Banks. He's posted more of the video sessions online.

The police stop by Victoria's place and tell her that Banks is missing. Banks placed a call to 911 and then disappeared. Frank shows up and talks the detectives into leaving. After they leave Frank tells Victoria he dropped by Banks's office and that her computer is missing. He thinks they need to find Banks before the police do. Victoria tries to call Conrad, who is in bed with Lydia and doesn't answer.

A super-drunk Daniel is hitting on some girls. Tyler orders yet another round of shots.

Emily flashes back to a young Amanda telling Banks that her father is innocent. Banks isn't buying it and threatens her with institutionalization. Nolan sends Emily video of Daniel at the bar flirting with the girls.

Ashley admits to Victoria that the DVD was briefly missing. Daniel and Tyler show up. Victoria is shocked at how drunk her son is. We all see that for some reason Tyler is stone cold sober.

Nolan and Emily sit at Jack's bar and watch TV coverage of Banks's disappearance. Nolan gives Jack the online link to Emily's session with Banks.

We see that Banks is locked in a storage shed. Emily is behind it. Emily ends up calling in an anonymous tip that gets her released.

Frank finds out that Banks has no idea who her attacker was. The storage unit was owned by Victoria's family.

Charlotte confides in Declan about her mother. He tells her that their mother left when he and Jack were young. He never sold the ring because part of him hopes she'll still return. Charlotte tells him the ring isn't real. They hold hands.

Not only is Banks's practice over, but she'll be spending the rest of her life looking over her shoulder. Emily calls Daniel. Tyler intercepts the call and deletes all of the missed calls from Daniel's phone. Victoria seems as if she may be having feelings for Frank. Jack watches Emily talk about a new guy who "may be the one."

In one of her sessions, Victoria talks about loving a man other than Conrad. Emily flashes back to sitting up with her father on a stormy night. She saw Victoria steal something of her father's and hand it to Frank. When Emily's father finds her she tells him that she had to see him. Victoria says she told Conrad she was leaving him and wants them to be together. Victoria glares at the young Amanda, seeming to know that she knows what happened.

description: Victoria's vulnerabilities are exposed when feelings of guilt and a fight with her daughter becomes too much to bear.
tags: ['guilt', 'fall', 'gift', 'jail', 'father son relationship', 'prison', 'brother brother relationship', 'bare chested male']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A woman's body falls on top of a car... then:

TWO DAYS EARLIER

Frank shows Victoria that Conrad transferred $10 million into Lydia's bank account.

Ashley tells Emily about Victoria and Frank looking into her possible involvement in the mother-daughter tea fiasco. She also mentions Daniel coming home drunk the night before. As a way to make it up to Victoria, Emily suggests Ashley find a way to get Victoria honored at the upcoming Open Arms charity event.

We see Emily look at an old newspaper headline of the airplane bombing. She recalls a letter from her father where he explains that Conrad and Victoria decided to make him the patsy for the crash to deflect attention from the fact Conrad had been laundering money for the terrorists.

Tyler's internship falls through and Conrad invites him to work at his company, along with Daniel. Conrad complains to Victoria about Daniel falling off the wagon.

Nolan drops by Emily's place and sneaks a knickknack onto her mantle. He tells her that Tyler was the problem with Daniel getting so drunk, all but force-feeding him drinks while remaining sober himself.

Conrad tells Victoria that he had to pay Lydia off since she has the power to "expose us."

Declan wants Jack to hire someone to help them run the bar.

Lydia drops by Emily's place and tells her that she's planning to contest the sale of the home. We see that the knickknack Nolan hid in the house contains a miniature video camera. Lydia sounds like she's going to come after Emily.

"We all have our South Fork Inn, Emily," Lydia coos, referring to the place where she got caught cheating with Conrad. "I just made it my mission to find yours."

Emily packs up some of Lydia's things to ship to her, including Nolan's hidden camera.

While getting ready for work Tyler mentions Conrad's affair with Lydia to Daniel, citing it as the main source of the tension in the Grayson household. Daniel did not know his father had cheated on his mother.

Victoria wants to spend more time with Charlotte to try and move past what happened at the tea. Charlotte still isn't ready to forgive her mother.

Charlotte signs for a present her father gave her mother. She steps out into the driveway to find a very expensive new car.

Daniel drops by the bar to get his credit card and apologize to Jack for the way he acted.

Emily makes an appearance at Victoria's weekly lunch. There, Ashley announces that this year's Open Arms events will honor the Victims United organization, a group started in honor of the plane crash victims that supports those impacted by terrorism around the world. It was originally endowed by Victoria and Conrad. Victoria is obviously uncomfortable by this, and Emily notices. Lydia stops by, uninvited, and bitterly congratulates Victoria. She adds that she wants to return to the "fold" and Victoria appears to accept her.

Conrad calls Victoria and asks how she likes the car. Cut to Charlotte at the bar showing Declan the $200,000 vehicle.

Lydia apologizes to Victoria and says she is her "only true friend," then leaves. After she's gone, Emily mentions Lydia's threat to Victoria. Emily also mentions finding a signed book that Dr. Banks gave to Lydia and points out Lydia was one of the only people whose sessions weren't exposed in the video.

Emily drops by Daniel's place, and they clear up the misunderstanding with the botched date the other night. They sit together and he tells her about his father cheating on his mother.

Victoria gives Charlotte the car. It doesn't help.

Tyler tells Daniel he lied to him about Emily to keep him from making a mistake. Daniel doesn't buy it.

Nolan notices that his video camera is now at Lydia's place. He's able to watch Conrad stopping by and yelling at her about her going to his house to see Victoria. She tells Conrad to help her get back on Victoria's good side and threatens to expose their framing of David Clark if he doesn't. Conrad responds by smashing a photograph of Victoria and Lydia together at a party, and storming out in a huff. When Lydia picks up the photo she notices what appears to be Emily in a wig, dressed as one of the caterers in the background.

Victoria tells Conrad and Frank she suspects Lydia was behind the tape. Frank is going to investigate her.

Nolan stops by and tells Emily that Lydia may be onto her, as Lydia is looking into rosters of a catering company that worked a New Year's Eve party several years ago. Emily explains that when she was just out of juvie, she wanted to look at the Graysons herself, and got hired by the company catering one of their events. Nolan then confesses to bugging her house because her father told him to look after her. She tells him to hack into the catering company's database and delete her name from the record.

At the Open Arms event, Emily implies to Victoria that the reason Daniel is not there is because of the problems with their relationship. Victoria is placed at the Victims United table.

We flashback to Victoria watching video of a mother that lost two sons in the crash. She told Conrad and Frank that she wants to help the victims. They opine that they don't think it's wise to expose the company that way.

Lydia makes another threat about getting her out of the house, informing Emily that she has found "her South Fork Inn." Emily calls Nolan, who says the catering company is faxing a copy of the employees roster to Lydia's house. Nolan tells her he'll go there and intercept the fax.

Cut to Frank snooping around Lydia's place. He finds the tea video, along with a copy of a speech she is supposedly going to give during the Open Arms event that will expose the Graysons. Frank calls Victoria with the information and they plan to handle it.

Lydia takes to the podium and, following a long venomous stare, innocently introduces Victoria and Conrad.

Charlotte and Declan are pulled over by the cops in the new car because Charlotte is speeding.

Daniel tells Conrad he doesn't want to follow his path. Angered, Conrad tells Daniel he's cutting him off from his trust fund until he comes around.

Meanwhile, Victoria tells Lydia that she can consider herself to be "back in the fold," but to make no mistake -- she despises Lydia. Victoria tells Lydia that every time she smiles at her, that she should consider that to be a sign of how much she despises her, and that every time they embrace, to think of the warmth she feels as Victoria's burning hatred for her former best friend. Victoria then hugs an uncomfortable-looking Lydia and says "good-bye."

Daniel tells Emily that his sister got arrested.

Frank is waiting for Lydia when she gets home. He accuses her of being behind "everything" and they begin to fight. The struggle spills over to the outside balcony, where she falls over the edge onto the roof of a car.

Nolan drops by and switches out the faxes. While he's there he grabs the photo. He hears sirens and looks down to see Lydia's body and a crowd gathering. He runs off.

At the police station Emily and Daniel appear to have made up. Jack shows up and isn't thrilled that Emily is there. The police thought Charlotte stole the car but everything has been worked out. Jack thanks Daniel for getting his brother off the hook and Daniel asks for a bartender job.

Back at Emily's place Daniel and Emily head to the bedroom.

Frank lets Victoria know that Lydia "jumped off her balcony."

Nolan goes to his computer and finds video of Frank fighting with Lydia. He leaves Emily a frantic message: "I think Frank just killed Lydia."

description: When incriminating surveillance video surfaces, the Graysons begin to distrust their head of security; the tension between Emily and Tyler comes to a head; the Porter boys make their moves.

synopsis_with_character_names:
Emily and Daniel wake up in bed together. Nolan comes by to tell her about Frank nearly killing Lydia, who is in a coma after her fall from her apartment terrace.

Daniel again blows Tyler off because he has plans with Emily.

Nolan shows Emily the video of Frank and Lydia. Nolan is worried that if Lydia wakes up she could expose Emily. Emily thinks they can pin most of what's been happening on Frank, particularly because he told the Graysons that Lydia tried to commit suicide.

Ashley is helping organize the Graysons' annual 4th of July party. Tyler tricks Ashley into helping him make a double date with Emily and Daniel.

Nolan drops by the bar and talks to Jack about continuing to pursue Emily. Emily calls Nolan to check on a file he is encrypting.

We see Conrad opening an E-mail with footage of Frank with Lydia in her apartment.

Ashley brings up the double date idea to Emily. Emily doesn't like the idea at first but agrees because Ashley, who is clearly a twit with no judgement about males, likes Tyler.

Declan asks Charlotte out. She says yes and also invites him to her parents' party. He passes on that.

Conrad fires Frank, saying it is because he is showing Victoria more loyalty than him but without mentioning the footage of him with Lydia. He cuts Frank a check and tells him his jet is ready to take him someplace far away. Frank isn't happy, mentioning that if it wasn't for him Conrad would be in prison.

Jack drops by to fix Emily's porch swing. He references the little girl who used to live there and her desire to move the swing to face the sun. Daniel shows up and tells Jack he's still interested in bartending. Jack wants him to start on the 4th holiday and Daniel doesn't mind.

Conrad tells Victoria that Frank has been trying to drive a wedge between them and shows her the video. She is stunned. Conrad has a gun, just in case Frank comes looking for them.

During the double date, Ashley mentions Frank being fired. Emily offers to go the bar instead of Victoria's party, but Daniel thinks she should make an appearance.

Declan asks Jack for a few hundred bucks to take Charlotte to a fancy dinner. He says no.

While Tyler spins a yarn about his rich family Emily starts asking pointed questions. She doesn't think he is who he says he is and doesn't hide it. Tyler eventually leaves and Daniel goes after him. Ashley is mad at Emily for chasing him away.

We see Declan taking some lobsters from pots.

Frank drops by unexpectedly to see how Victoria is doing. She tells him about the video and he says, "I did it for you." He tries to kiss her just as Conrad asks what she's doing from upstairs. She leaves to join her husband.

Tyler mentions Daniel's new job to Victoria, making it sound like Emily's idea. Daniel comes down and argues with his mother about the job. He also says he's going to work instead of attending her party.

Daniel drops by Emily's house. She tells him she was going to apologize to Tyler and they start to fool around.

Frank pays the security guard in Lydia's building to get him access to footage from the cameras in the lobby.

Fooling around with Emily causes Daniel to be late for his first day. Jack isn't happy to see a hickey on Daniel's neck. Two lobster fishermen drop by to rough-up Declan, who has been selling their catch. Daniel ends up helping to get rid of the guys by paying them off at above market price.

Jack and Declan decide they are going to Victoria's party.

Frank spots Nolan on video breaking into Lydia's place.

At the party Ashley tells Emily that Victoria sent Tyler to the bar to try and bring Daniel back. Emily spots Jack.

Tyler talks Daniel into doing one shot with him. When Daniel's back is turned, he slips something into Daniel's glass.

At the party Declan tells Charlotte that he can't compete with the money of her other suitors. She says she doesn't care. Jack asks Emily if there is a place where they can talk privately.

Daniel begins spilling drinks. He tells Tyler that something is wrong and Tyler tells the other bartender that Daniel needs to lie down.

Jack confesses his feelings to Emily. She tells her that he's saying it to the wrong girl, since she's involved in a relationship. He says the only reason he's bringing it up is that what he feels only comes along once or twice in a lifetime. He says he'll leave her alone if he's the only one who feels that way. She says, "I'm sorry, Jack." He leaves.

Tyler sits Daniel down and starts to tell him how wrong Emily is for him. Daniel yells at Tyler to leave him alone. Tyler says fine, have it your way, walks downstairs and deliberately bangs himself into a post, creating a cut on his forehead.

Frank pulls a gun on Nolan and tells him they need to talk. Tyler shows up at the party and tells Victoria that the bloody cut on his forehead came from Daniel hitting him while he was drinking. Frank pulls Nolan into a side room and demands to know how much Conrad is paying him. Frank sneaks away when he hears people approaching. Tyler tells Emily that Daniel hit him.

Nolan takes Emily aside and tell her that Frank is better at the game they are playing than they are and he wants out.

Jack comes back to the bar and finds Daniel passed out upstairs. We see Declan and Charlotte making out. Emily comes home and finds Jack has moved the porch swing to the place she wanted it as a girl.

Frank calls Victoria and asks how Conrad had the surveillance equipment installed. He starts to tell her that he thinks they are being set up and Conrad grabs the phone and yells at him to stop calling his wife. Victoria asks Conrad who made the recording.

The episode ends with Frank at Emily's place, watching her on the porch.

description: A high-profile newspaper story interrupts the Graysons' wishes to lay low on their 25th wedding anniversary; Frank digs into Emily's past in hope of proving his loyalty to Victoria.

synopsis_with_character_names:
Victoria and Conrad are doing an interview awkwardly. They are going to be getting the front page of the New York Times "Style Section" in honor of their 25th anniversary.

Afterwards Conrad tells Victoria that pretending nothing has happened is in their best interest. Frank has cashed his severance check and a guard has been placed at Lydia's bedside.

Emily drops by to see a nervous Nolan, who has hired himself a bodyguard. Nolan wonders if perhaps she's falling for Daniel.

Charlotte does an interview with the reporter with Victoria. Daniel is late, but Tyler stops by and tells them he's been doing charity work. Victoria and Conrad are doing a smallish dinner for the anniversary. Tyler wants to bring Ashley, but Charlotte isn't allowed to bring a date.

Tyler lies to Daniel and tells him the cut on his head came from Daniel slamming his head into a wall. Emily drops by to see Daniel. Tyler leaves, but manages to electronically eavesdrop on Emily telling Daniel she'd rather he not mention her to the reporter.

Emily comes home to find Frank in her home. He has her gun. He tells her he no longer works for the Graysons. He's discovered that she spent time in juvie and threatens to find out the rest of her story.

When Frank leaves Emily grabs a phone from a secret compartment in the floor. She uses it call a Warden Sharon Stiles (CCH Pounder), as Amanda Clarke. She tells Stiles that she thinks she's going to need her help, "Again."

Daniel makes reference to the reporter that he has a girlfriend. He won't tell her any specifics but says "hopefully" it's something serious. The second Daniel leaves Tyler walks in and drops Emily's name.

Despite her mother's wishes, Charlotte invites Declan to the anniversary dinner.

Nolan tells Jack he still doesn't think Emily is serious about Daniel. Jack angrily tells him to stop hanging around the bar.

The reporter drops by Emily's place unannounced to ask about her relationship with Daniel. Once Emily realizes Tyler is involved she invites the reporter in.

Victoria stops by to see Lydia. The doctor says it's possible she could regain consciousness at any time. Frank walks into the room and tells her he's leaving town for a few days. He promises to redeem himself to her "or die trying."

Frank goes upstate to see Stiles. Stiles explains that what Emily did was in self-defense. She won't give him access to records without a court order.

Declan shows Jack the Times article on the Graysons. It mentions the bar, but has a huge picture of Daniel and Emily together.

We see Emily and Daniel frolicking on the beach together. When they come back Tyler brings them framed copies of the article. Tyler admits that he was the one who told the reporter. Daniel is furious.

Stiles calls Emily and says she thinks Frank seems determined.

Victoria has paid Lydia's hospital bills. She tells Conrad that she and Lydia aren't that much different. Victoria flashes back to a late night meeting with Frank just before the authorities grab Emily's father.

Emily asks Nolan to find something about Tyler she can use to discredit him with the Graysons.

Emily stops by the bar to see Jack. Business has been booming since the article came out. She gives him an old mariner's compass to thank him for fixing the swing.

Tyler and Ashley shop for clothes for the party. When she ducks into a store Nolan walks by and references knowing about a restraining order someone named Leslie Montgomery filed against Tyler. Nolan tells him he'll explain what he wants that night at his place. Tyler is reluctant, but Nolan is very forceful in his demand.

Frank breaks into Stiles' office. He finds the file for Emily Thorne and begins taking snapshots of the documents.

Victoria isn't thrilled to see Declan is there as Charlotte's date. Tyler is "running a bit late" but Daniel tells his mother they shouldn't wait.

Nolan tells Tyler he knows the Leslie person was a man and that he is some kind of hustler. Tyler says a few years ago his parents lost everything and he had to drop out of school. He's trying to nose his way into Conrad's company to turn his life around and knowledge of his background would ruin everything. Tyler says "let's make a deal" and, recognizing something in his antagonist, begins to kiss Nolan.

The article is discussed during the anniversary dinner. The mood is getting awkward.

Frank goes to a strip club and takes a special interest in one dancer who matches the mug shot of Emily Thorne.

After a few negative references to his bar, Declan mentions Emily giving his brother a gift. She tells Daniel "it was nothing," but Declan says it meant a lot to Jack. He says that in their mind Jack will never be good enough and he now knows the feeling. He leaves in a huff, as does Daniel, and Emily. Charlotte leaves as well and the couple is all alone.

Frank gets a lap dance with the pole dancer (Margarita Levieva) he was staring at. He wants to talk about her name, Amanda Clarke. He says: "Your name's not really Amanda Clarke, is it? It's Emily Thorne."

Emily and Daniel fight over her seeing Jack. He's upset she didn't tell him about seeing him. She says she's scared because she's falling in love with him. He leaves to take a walk.

Victoria and Conrad yell at each other about the shame of their marriage. He points out that she never looked at him the way she looked at David Clarke.

Declan goes back to the bar and tells Jack about the dinner disaster. Jack thinks he should talk to Charlotte herself, just as she walks in.

Frank explains his theory that the dancer was paid to switch identities with the real Amanda Clarke. The money has run out. She's been trying to find Amanda for years. Frank tells her who Amanda is now and that he works for her boyfriend's father. Amanda offers to continue the conversation in the strip club's parking lot after her shift had ended, and Frank agrees to meet with her.

Daniel and Victoria talk on the balcony about things not going as planned. He says he can't stop thinking about Emily. She tells him she doesn't want him to get hurt. He says that you can't chose who you love.

Victoria flashes back to practicing her false testimony against David Clarke with Frank and Conrad. Conrad tells her that they will lose everything if she doesn't lie convincingly.

Later, in the strip club's dark parking lot, Frank calls Victoria. He says that "Emily Thorne is not who she..." but he is cut off mid-sentence when Amanda Clarke (the real Emily) hits him over the head with a tire iron. She takes his phone and hangs up. When Frank's leg twitches Amanda moves in and appears to finish him off.

Tyler finally shows up, well after the dinner is over. He's got a rose for Ashley but she's really pissed. She tells him she's trying to improve her stake in life and he admits to his family's financial issues. He tells her he stood her up to make copies of Conrad's confidential database and will eventually be indispensible. She thinks they are similar.

Charlotte tells Declan she really likes him. They kiss.

On the phone, Nolan tells Emily that Tyler is a bit of a con man but, he adds, he doesn't know that you can't con a con. On a computer screen, we see that Nolan apparently filmed himself having sex with Tyler ostensibly to use as leverage later. Emily tells Nolan that whatever he's doing, to keep it up. She hangs up just as Daniel comes to sit down beside her, on her porch swing.

Daniel tells Emily he's falling in love with her as well.

At the hospital, Conrad is sitting by Lydia when she wakes up.

Later, there is a knock on Emily's door. It's "Amanda." As they embrace, we flashback to them meeting in juvie detention when Amanda was Emily and vice versa. We see them get into a physical altercation where "Emily" gets the better of her adversary.

In the present day, "Amanda" tells Emily that somebody named Frank was snooping around, but "I took care of him." She gives her Frank's phone. As Emily is removing the SIM card, Victoria leaves another message with Frank, saying that she is now officially worried and wants him to elaborate on his previous message that Emily Thorne is not who she says she is.

But as she leaves the message, we see Frank's body lying motionless in the brush by the side of a busy road and next to a long chain link security fence.

description: Emily's plot continues to unravel; tensions escalate in Victoria's relationship with her family; Lydia's memory raises concerns with the Graysons; a friend starts to play dirty.
tags: ['treachery', 'homosexual', 'swimming pool', 'gay', 'father son relationship', 'jealousy', 'brother brother relationship', 'false identity', 'bare chested male', 'bribery']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Emily/real Amanda and Amanda/real Emily are in the car. Emily is upset that she killed Frank and they flashback to juvi. Emily drops Amanda off at Nolan's and tells him not to let her out of his sight.

Lydia is coming out of her coma and doesn't seem to have much memory of her fall. The doctor tells Victoria and Conrad that everything should come back. Conrad thinks they need to get their story straight as to why Frank attacked her.

Charlotte wakes up in the morning having spent the night at the bar. After she rushed home Declan tells Jack nothing happened.

Tyler tells Daniel his father is moving his home office to a hotel. Emily stops by and Daniel tells her he's thinking about taking Conrad up on his internship offer. Ashley spent the night with Tyler.

Lydia is going to be recovering at Victoria's place. Victoria notices that both Ashley and Charlotte are still wearing the previous night's dresses. Lydia doesn't remember Emily. Conrad isn't thrilled that Lydia is staying there and they argue about who is to blame for what happened to her.

Declan wants Jack to talk to Nolan about taking the boat out. Daniel stops by and quits his bartending gig.

Faux Amanda is making herself very at home. Nolan calls Emily who says she needs to stay there a few days. Emily wants her to Photoshop her face out of the picture from Lydia's place. Nolan spots blood on Amanda's jacket.

Daniel drops by his father's office. Tyler eavesdrops on Daniel asking Conrad about working for the family business. Conrad is overjoyed. The police call looking for Conrad.

Jack drops by Nolan's place and finds Amanda. Nolan's not there but Amanda starts flirting pretty heavily.

Conrad tells Victoria Frank's body was found in a ditch. Conrad points out that their secret has died with him.

Amada makes cocktails for the two of them. Jack loves them and tells her to stop by the bar. Emily drops by with clothes for Amanda and Jack leaves. Emily's clearly concerned about her being a wildcard.

Amanda tells Emily she likes using her name and doesn't like Emily's plan of shipping her off to France. Amanda says Emily's the closest thing she's had to a sister. We flashback to juvi when Stiles told her it would be in her best interest to make friends with this Emily Thorne person.

Emily brings over more of Lydia's things. After Emily leaves, Lydia tells Victoria she remembers Emily being in a New Year's Eve photo.

Ashley tells Tyler she's getting sick of Victoria. He concurs based on getting the boot when Daniel showed back up. He thinks Emily is the worst of them all and says they've been playing too nice.

Nolan's bodyguard shows him that Frank was killed.

The police think Frank was the victim of a robbery-carjacking. Victoria tells Conrad about Frank's final 'phone call telling her Emily was not who she says she is. Victoria calls the police.

Nolan asks Amanda about Frank and the blood stains, then shows her he found Frank's wallet in her possession. He wants to know "Who the Hell are you?"

Nolan and Amanda come to Emily's place. He is freaked out and doesn't want to go to prison, but Emily says Amanda's on her way to Europe. Emily gives Nolan Frank's 'phone to dispose of. Emily's given Amanda a new identity. Amanda wants Emily to come with her, but she says she can't.

Conrad tells Charlotte about moving out. She doesn't want be left there with her mother.

Lydia and Victoria look through all of her pictures but do not find anything with Emily in it. Nolan's Photoshop switcheroo has been successful.

Charlotte drops by the bar and is upset about her family.

Emily comes home to find two cops in her home talking to Daniel. They're investigating Frank's murder and ask about him making several calls to Victoria before he died. They tell Emily and Daniel about Victoria looking into Emily's past. She admits to being in juvi because she "took care of" an abusive stepfather. Plus Emily has an alibi for when Frank was killed.

Daniel is furious with Victoria for sending the police to Emily's house and looking into his girlfriend. He asks his mother why she feels so threatened all the time and warns her to stay away from Emily. He tells Victoria she's lost the last person in the family who defended her.

Nolan officially gives Jack back his boat and tells him he doesn't have to pretend to be his friend any more. Jack apologizes for being a jerk and pours him a drink. He asks about Amanda and Nolan tells him she's gone.

Daniel wants to stay with Emily for awhile. We can see that Amanda is watching them from the porch.

Victoria asks Conrad a bunch of questions about Frank's death, implying that he might have been involved. They both are accusing each other.

Victoria goes to Lydia's room. While Lydia sleeps Victoria takes the 'phone out of her room. Lydia was pretending to be asleep and notices what she did.

Emily flashes back once again to juvi. She showed up when Amanda was released and tells her that she's come into some money. She gives Amanda a check for $500,000 and says "I have a favor to ask you." In present day we see Emily burning a mug shot of the real Emily Thorne.

Victoria shreds the speech Lydia was going to give exposing Victoria. Tyler finds it and starts piecing it back together. Emily leaves in the middle of the night and plants a GPS.

Amanda, obviously not on an airplane to Europe and intending some sort of double-cross of Emily, walks into Jack's bar after last call and orders a drink. She tells him "I might just stay awhile."

description: Realizing she has lost a valuable ally in Amanda, Emily reaches out to her mentor; Victoria finds herself all alone; Tyler's influence continues to be a threat.
tags: ['bikini', 'translator', 'translation', 'interpreter', 'japanese', 'undressing', 'towel', 'bathing', 'swimming pool', 'blackmail', 'swimwear', 'competition', 'bare chested male', 'gay kiss', 'gay character']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Emily in voice-over is talking about lovers and their secrets. She is referencing her father.

Emily didn't sleep well as she is still getting used to sleeping with Daniel.

Lydia is fully awake and Victoria is waiting on her hand and foot.

Amanda is hitting on Jack pretty hardcore. She tells him she's staying in a hotel and wants a ride with him in the boat. Nolan sees this.

Tyler is playing volleyball in a game with Daniel. Ashley asks Emily about shacking up with Daniel so quick. She tells Emily that Victoria has been grouchy since kicking Conrad out of the house. Nolan calls Emily and tells her about Amanda.

Victoria brings Lydia food. Lydia remembers the night of the benefit and recalls Victoria saying she would never accept her. Southampton PD shows up with a warrant to search the place in reference to Frank's killing. They're there because they've picked up Frank's cell signal. After a brief search, the lead detective tells Victoria that they have found his 'phone on the porch.

During a mild confrontation between to two girls who've switched identities, Amanda gives Emily a story about being stopped by security in the airport on her way out of the country. She tells Emily she doesn't want to go to Europe. She wants friends and a life. Emily tells her she can't stay and Amanda says she never asked for permission.

Conrad wants Tyler and Daniel to compete to be the first to land a big client at an upcoming investor party. Daniel is still giving his mother the cold shoulder. Victoria tells Conrad that the police are building a case against him. He swears he's innocent and if he's framed he'll bring her down with him.

Declan and Nolan ask Jack about Amanda (who he knows as Kara).

Faux Emily flashes back to telling real Emily about what will happen if they find out. She talks about her father being accused of killing all those people. She is tutoring faux Amanda in knowledge of her life.

In present day Nolan calls Emily to say Amanda is not leaving town. Emily says she can't force her to do anything. Nolan's worreed about Jack falling for Amanda. Nolan is called with word that one of his credit cards has been stolen. He knows it was Tyler.

Tyler gives Ashley an expensive dress to wear at the investor party. Nolan calls Tyler to complain about him using his credit card for a $5,000 on a dress. Nolan wants to meet.

Victoria drops by to see Emily and talks about her strained relationship with Daniel. Victoria doesn't trust her and reference things in past. This leads to Victoria flashing back to Emily's father not being able to find his computer. He wants them to tell Conrad about their illicit relationship and she says it will only be a secret for a little while longer.

Emily swears she has not interest in hurting Daniel and wants them to work out their differences.

Daniel is mad at his mother for the fact Emily is a suspect in Frank's murder. Emily tells him about Victoria dropping by and says he needs to limit her power over him. She thinks he needs to forgive his mother.

Nolan tells Tyler he's not as stupid as the other people Tyler is coning. Tyler moves in on him sexually and is rebuffed. Tyler wants him to be an investor at Conrad's party and buy in for $20 million. Tyler tries to use sex to get what he wants but Nolan brushes him off again. When Nolan leaves to meet someone Tyler jumps on his computer.

Victoria and Charlotte argue over Declan.

Victoria asks Lydia if she needs anything. She gives Lydia a pill which she ultimately spits out after Victoria leaves.

Amanda is drinking at Jack's bar. Nolan wants her to stay away. Amanda says Emily told her about who he is. Amanda says she does things on her own terms, referencing the "ripple effect" if Emily was to blow their story.

Victoria drops by the bar looking for Declan. Victoria tries to pay him off to stop seeing her daughter. He says he doesn't want her money. She says odds are that the relationship won't last and asks him for his "number."

Nolan has covertly filmed what Tyler did on his computer. He sees that he has pieced back together Lydia's shredded speech about the Graysons.

Emily helps Daniel prep for the investor meeting. Nolan calls to tell her about "multiple code reds." He mentions the Lydia speech and her attempt to bring down the Graysons and their conspiracy against her dad. He also knows Tyler Googled the name "David Clarke." She tells him he should pretend to invest with Tyler in order to keep him occupied for the evening. Emily hangs up with Nolan and calls a man with a deep voice. She says "It's Emily Thorne. I need to see you."

Declan doesn't tell Jack what Victoria wanted to do. Charlie calls Declan to ask about the visit. He just says they need to talk.

Conrad drops by to see Lydia, who complains about the "witch" giving her pills.

Amanda goes on out on the boat with Jack. They kiss.

Charlotte tells Victoria that Declan just broke up with her. Victoria tells her is it for the best and says she loves her. Charlotte gets her keys back.

Daniel is working on a Japanese CEO and getting help from Emily. She speaks Japanese and he wants to talk to her him the bar. Alone at the bar it's clear this is the man she spoke with earlier on the 'phone. He says: "Inside the viper's nest, you must be a viper too."

Tyler is striking out with investors. Nolan shows up and says he wants to talk in private. Victoria apologizes to Emily in front of Daniel. She thanks him and leaves the mother and son together. They start to make nice and Conrad calls Daniel away.

Nolan says the only way he's giving Tyler money is if he never lies to him again and adds that he wants then to spend more "quality time together." He says he'll have his guy wire the funds next week. They start to kiss just as a horrified Ashley walks in and rushes out.

Tyler runs after Ashley and grabs her before she can get away. He says he was doing it to get Nolan's money. He wants her to step her game up. Conrad shows up and takes him away.

Nolan finds a copy of Lydia's re-assembled speech in the trash.

Conrad says that the Japanese man isn't going to commit to Daniel, but Nolan is going to spend $20 million. Tyler will get his commission as soon as the funds come through.

On the boat Jack tells Amanda about how free he feels on the water. She begins to cry and talks about how hard things about have been for her. He says she can tell him anything and she tells him that Nolan knew her father years ago: "And so did you." He looks at her incredulously. "Amanda?" he asks.

Conrad tells Victoria that he's moved Lydia out of the house "while you were busy stabbing people in the back."

Charlotte stops by Declan's apartment. He was waiting for her. He tells his "number" was $100,000, and Victoria gave him $25,000, which he's going to use for a place by the water where they can have privacy. They start to get physically intimate.

Ashley asks Victoria why she hired her. Victoria says it's because she's the best at what she does "and you're close with Emily." She asks for information about Emily. Ashley says Emily can be "tricky" and Victoria asks her to lunch the next day.

Jack drops by to see Emily. He says that Kara/Amanda is the girl he knew that lived in that house. Amanda is there and he wants to show her the swing. Amanda/Emily is completely adopting Emily/Amanda's life.

Flashback to Emily and Amanda making an exchange. Emily opens a box with money and a letter. It says "if you chose this path, and I hope you won't" she needs to call Satoshi. She called him and he tells her to continue her training and meet him in Japan.

Again, in voice-over, Emily talks about the deepest secrets being the ones that "we bury from ourselves."

description: After discovering a secret, Emily questions Nolan's loyalty while working closely with her mentor; Amanda settles into life in the Hamptons; as Victoria regains some power, things between her and Conrad take a turn for the worse.
tags: ['blackmail', 'sabotage', 'vandalism', 'father son relationship', 'swimming pool', 'sex scene', 'fraud', 'bully', 'gay character']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Emily is brushing up on her martial arts with Takeda (Hiroyuki Sanada). He references her relationship with the son of her enemy and tells her if he she lets emotions guide her, she will fail. She talks about the two primary obstacles to her goal, Tyler and Amanda.

Conrad has filed for divorce. Ashley tells Victoria she'll be of service and Victoria wants her to help bring her son back to her.

Tyler assures Ashley that what she caught him doing with Nolan was done with their future in mind. He seems to talk her into sticking with him.

Amanda and Jack talk about his dog Sammy. She clearly doesn't know the whole story behind her namesake's history with him. She is going to be staying in The Hamptons and they seem to be hitting it off well.

Nolan tells Emily about Tyler searching his laptop for information on David Clarke. She asks him to pull back the money he wired to Tyler so that he will try to blackmail Conrad with the Lydia's speech. When he leaves the room she grabs his flash drive and sees the video of him hooking up with Tyler.

Daniel tells Emily about his parents' upcoming divorce. He clearly is jealous of how close Tyler has been getting with Conrad. She tells him exactly how Tyler was able to get Nolan's money.

Tyler tells Nolan he wants to celebrate with a trip out of town.

A lawyer named Ryan Huntley (James McCaffrey) tells Victoria that Conrad asked to retain him in the divorce. He declined and says he would prefer to represent her, although it is a clear violation of any BAR association's Code of Ethics. Daniel and Emily join Victoria for lunch. With Daniel out of the house she says she likes having Tyler staying in the guest house.

Emily drops by to see Jack. They talk about Sammy and the circumstances that surrounded her Emily giving him the dog when they were little. She flashes back to giving the puppy to Jack before being taken away by Child Welfare Protective Services. She gives him a note giving Amanda permission to come by the house whenever she wants to.

Tyler brags to Daniel about being poised to get the corner office in Conrad's company. Daniel wonders how he was able to land Nolan's money so quickly. After Daniel leaves we see that Tyler appears to be out of a prescription for a drug used to treat schizophrenia.

Amanda tells Emily that she doesn't quite know enough about her back-story to interact with Jack. Emily gives her a childhood journal, so she'll know "absolutely everything." Emily stresses that she doesn't want Jack to get hurt. Emily introduces Amanda to Daniel. When Amanda leaves Emily pretends not to know exactly who Amanda Clarke really is. He wants her to translate for him that night during a dinner with Takeda.

Nolan asks Amanda why she's still in town. She says that Jack wants her there and Emily is warming to her.

Declan tells Jack about getting a place with Charlie. He hates the idea, saying he's too young and Charlie deserves to be with somebody who has an education.

With Daniel sitting at the table, Takeda tells Emily in Japanese he's worried she's letting her heart cloud her mind's goal. She assures him that isn't happening. When he leaves she tells Daniel he's agreed to invest $50 million with Conrad's company. Of course, it's actually her money Takeda will be investing.

Nolan is pretty upset about Amanda being in the loop. She references him being "out of control" with Tyler, but says she has that situation under control.

Tyler learns about Daniel's big score with Takeda. Tyler points out that he won't be getting the commission like he did with Nolan. After Tyler leaves Daniel decides to tell his father exactly how Tyler got the investment with Nolan.

Amanda now tells Jack about them finding bottles in the sand when they were younger, clearly something she read in the diary.

Victoria agrees to retain Huntley. He tells her she must give him full access to all of her records and be willing to do anything it takes to win the case, even fight dirty.

Declan tells Charlie it doesn't make sense for them to move in together.

Conrad tries to fire Tyler for securing the contract with Nolan in a less-than-honorable manner. Tyler responds by saying that if he's fired he'll expose Conrad and Victoria's role in framing David Clarke for their role in the plane crash.

Daniel doesn't like finding Amanda digging around Emily's place. She walks over and tells him it's okay. Amanda leaves and he tells Emily to "be careful with her."

Charlie catches Victoria snooping through her computer. She says she isn't moving in with Declan, but all she really wants is to get away from her. She chooses her father.

Nolan tells Tyler he's pulling his investment. Tyler responds by referencing the video of their sexual encounter. Nolan is genuinely shocked that Tyler is aware of the video. Tyler demands to see it and when Nolan shows it to him he pockets the flash drive and throws Nolan's laptop in the pool.

Jack makes Amanda a romantic dinner. He tells her he saved a keepsake from when they were kids.

After Daniel leaves Emily's place Takeda shows up on her porch. He's convinced she is in love with Daniel and he can therefore do nothing more to help her. She begs him not to abandon her, but he says: "You are on your own."

Tyler looks through the flash drive and finds Lydia telling Conrad about being threatened by Frank.

When Victoria tells Daniel that Tyler is still staying there he calls his father. Conrad tells Daniel that he "settled the matter" with Tyler but did not fire him. Daniel is furious.

Charlie shows up at Conrad's door and says she wants to live with him.

Ashley joins Tyler for dinner.

A livid Daniel tells Victoria his plan is to remain with Conrad's company but do whatever he can to help his mother in the divorce.

Nolan is pissed at Emily for telling people about the video. She is upset he sabotaged their alliance. He points out that unlike her, when he had the opportunity to expose her he didn't do it. He's tired of playing her evil games and is glad her father isn't alive to see what she's become.

Daniel calls Emily from his mother's place. Victoria overhears the conversation and learns that Amanda Clarke is in town.

Emily looks through her records and finds a letter from Huntley to her father saying that he will not be moving forward with his appeal of the treason conviction. She then flashes back to paying Huntley a visit as Amanda Clarke and asking him why he dropped her father's appeal. In present day she looks at a newspaper clipping of Huntley being given an award for his low income legal work.

The unethical attorney will likely become her next target.

description: An increasingly unstable Tyler crashes Daniel's intimate birthday celebration; Conrad and Victoria use Charlotte as a pawn in their bitter divorce battle; Emily's plan starts to unravel.
tags: ['blackmail', 'homosexual', 'party', 'jealousy', 'brother brother relationship', 'father son relationship', 'gay']
synopsis_with_character_names:
At an outdoors dinner table, the show's principles are frozen in shock as a drunk-looking Tyler points a gun at Emily's head.

But two days earlier...

Daniel tells Emily he has a birthday coming up and he's worried Victoria will go overboard. Emily suggests a clambake on the beach. He loves the idea and says he'll tell his mother it was his idea.

Conrad drops by to talk to Daniel. He doesn't want to lose his kids and admits hiring Tyler was a mistake. Conrad says he'll fire Tyler and Daniel tells him he'll return to work. After Conrad leaves Daniel calls his mother to say he's in place to help her obtain information that will help her in her divorce action. He tells her wants a clambake and Victoria immediately knows it was Emily's idea.

Emily apologizes to Nolan. She says she's made sure Victoria knows Amanda is in town. Nolan is tracking the GPS on Tyler's cell phone.

Conrad and Victoria have their first divorce discussion with counsel. In return for surrendering claim to all their other properties, Victoria wants Grayson Manor. Conrad is seeking full custody of Charlie. Since the prenuptial agreement from 25 years earlier was signed while she was pregnant, Victoria's lawyer wants to throw it out on grounds of duress.

Tyler tells Conrad he no longer wants to work for him. Tyler says he has video of Frank tossing Lydia off the roof and a recording of him discussing framing David Clarke. He wants Conrad to make him an offer or he'll turn what he has over to prosecutors.

Huntley (James McCaffrey), her attorney, wants Victoria to expose Conrad's infidelity in open court. She's not sure, but tells him that she's lying about having been pregnant when she signed the prenup. She had already miscarried.

On Huntley's way out of the house Emily spots him. She flashes back to confronting him just after her father had been murdered in prison. She shows him evidence he didn't use for her father's appeal and says "they got you, didn't they?"

Present day Emily asks Victoria for a picture of her and Daniel she wants for a scrapbook. Emily brings up Amanda and says she and Jack are working on the party. She asks if they can spend the night after the party.

Nolan directs Emily to the video camera Tyler had left in the guest house. She also spots his meds and calls the doctor on the bottle. The doctor is on leave "after the attack" and says detectives have been searching for him for weeks. Tyler returns and can't find the camera. Emily watches through a window as he destroys the room in a rage, focusing on a picture of Emily and Daniel.

Emily tells Nolan that the anti-psychotic Tyler was taking is a serious drug. Not taking it could cause violent episodes. She wants Nolan to call Tyler's brother. The brother Alexander, a doctor, agrees to come immediately. Nolan arranges for a private jet to fly him in from California.

Conrad tells Victoria about Tyler's blackmail attempts. He's figured out that Tyler is no longer in school and they wonder if he's been planning this for years.

Emily shows Daniel and Ashley the bottle of Tyler's meds she found.

Declan tells Amanda it's weird he's helping plan a party for Emily's boyfriend. Amanda asks Jack about Emily. She sounds a little jealous.

Jack drops by on Tyler. He says "we're done" and tells him to leave. Tyler threatens him with the information he has and Daniel starts to call the cops. Tyler leaves.

Before the party Emily asks Jack about Amanda. He says it's hard for her to be happy. Emily flashes back to the two of them as kids.

Jack tells Emily he's making sure the gun is somewhere handy. She gets a call from Nolan, who says Tyler's GPS is showing he's on a plane for San Francisco. She invites Nolan to the party.

Nolan hangs up and Tyler shows up from behind him with a knife in his hand. He wants back-ups for all the files and the video from the camera, and stabs Nolan in the shoulder with a knife to force him to comply. Tyler looks at the live video image of Emily and Jack talking about him. He says he shipped his phone to San Francisco ahead of him.

Emily and Daniel talk poetry.

Tyler has tied Nolan up on a chair inside his home. He struggles to get free.

At the party Emily makes a crack about Tyler and Ashley seems a bit defensive. Amanda is formally introduced to Daniel's parents. Victoria flashes back to a long-ago conversation with David who wants her to meet Amanda. Amanda says she's thinking of moving there permanently.

Alexander knocks on Nolan's door but the gagged Nolan can't get his attention.

Dinner is served at Daniel's party under a canopy on the beach.

Nolan finally gets Alexander's attention and directs him to a spare key.

Nolan calls Emily to warn her that Tyler is on his way. Tyler answers the phone.

Victoria gives Daniel a "memory book" for his present, something very similar to what Emily had told her she was making for him.

Emily goes inside to get the cake. Tyler surprised her from behind looking for the camera. She starts ripping at him and slips something into his pocket. He grabs the pistol and points it at her.

Emily comes outside with the cake. Tyler is following her with gun drawn. Victoria begs him not to hurt her children. Tyler wants to play "truth or die." If somebody doesn't answer a question truthfully he'll shoot somebody. He asks Conrad what really happened to David Clarke. When Conrad doesn't answer he points the gun at Emily. At this moment Alexander and Nolan arrive. Alexander says he wants to go talk about things "just the two of us." Daniel tackles Tyler and knocks the gun away.

The police leave and Conrad tells Victoria that Frank's wallet was found in Tyler's jacket. He's now the prime suspect in Frank' murder. This means Conrad is no longer being looked at and Victoria and her legal team can have the "battle royale" they want.

Nolan mentions to Emily that the police didn't find any cartridges in her gun. She was apparently prepared.

On their way home Amanda says something to Jack about maybe their being more to the David Clarke story than they've been told.

Huntley drops by Victoria's place late that night. He's found a doctor willing to falsify documents to say that she was still pregnant when she signed the prenup.

description: Emily targets Mason Treadwell, an author with ties to the Graysons and the Clarkes; Conrad shows how dirty he is willing to get in the divorce.
tags: ['blackmail', 'female female kiss', 'fire', 'arson', 'father son relationship']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Emily is reading a book about her father written by Mason Treadwell. We see the image of her reading the same book as a child and crying. Daniel comes home and says he has decided to put business school on hold to stick with the family company. He tells her he's thinking about moving back home. He brings up them moving in together after the season, but Emily says she doesn't want to move in with anybody until she's married.

Victoria, Emily and Nolan attend a Treadwell (Roger Bart) reading where Emily introduces herself and has him sign a copy of his book. She introduces him to Nolan and he seems interested in writing the biography of the young billionaire. He'll be reading excerpts from his upcoming memoire at Victoria's. She wants them to have lunch.

Emily calls Jack at the bar and thanks him for his help with Tyler. As he hangs up, Amanda pushes for a trip to Atlantic City. Jack declines and it seems she doesn't think he's fun.

At lunch Victoria tells Treadwell she wants him to interview Amanda. He doesn't like the idea and she reminds him that she made his career. He reluctantly agrees.

Emily reads her father's journal. David thought Treadwell would be an impartial observer who could help him. She watches an old news clip where Treadwell practically says he thinks David is mentally ill. She draws an X through Treadwell's picture on the dust jacket.

Treadwell drops by the bar and introduces himself to Amanda, explaining their history. He wants them to get together.

Huntley tells Victoria that Conrad is trying to strong-arm her out of her shares of the company. He suggests that she combine her shares with Daniel's, which are part of a trust from his grandmother.

Declan takes Charlie to visit her potential boarding school. It seems like they aren't going to have much time together and it bothers him.

Daniel asks Conrad about releasing his trust, calling it a show of faith and saying he wants "a seat at the table." Conrad sounds supportive. Conrad's attorney Barbara Snow (Merrin Dungey) drops by and Conrad tells her to have release of the shares contingent upon Daniel marrying.

Emily and Nolan stop by Treadwell's cottage. He shows them the only working copy of his memoirs, as well as all the audio recordings of his interviews. He mentions the interview with Amanda.

That evening, Amanda is getting pretty crazy behind the bar and Jack asks her to tone it down. She doesn't and goes as far as to make out with a cute blond woman to create a reaction, and then announces dollar shots as she pours hard liquor into any paying customer's mouth. Emily stops and talks to the increasingly jealous Amanda. She asks about Treadwell and Amanda says "so what?" Emily tells her there is more to the story of her father, but needs Amanda's help.

Meanwhile, Jack tells Declan he's worried about being over his head with Amanda.

The next day, Emily, Daniel and Nolan spend time at the shooting range. Daniel mentions a meeting with a prospective investor and takes off. After he leaves Emily tells Nolan she wants them to control the story with Amanda's meeting with Treadwell. We get a flashback to Treadwell's interview with young Amanda, when he used a different first name. Back then Treadwell told her he didn't think David was guilty. Alone on the firing line, Emily coolly shoots the center out of the target.

Daniel meets with potential investor Sophie Arnault (Morgan Hewitt), the very young granddaughter of a billionaire. Instantly she seems interested in Daniel.

Amanda speaks with Treadwell wearing a hidden earpiece. Emily is feeding her answers from a remote location. Emily has Amanda ask about why he didn't follow-up on what she told him when she was a girl. He says he just printed what he thought was the "most logical." She charges him with being in Victoria's pocket and tells him an upcoming public reading at Victoria's is his last chance to come clean.

Daniel tells Victoria he thinks the meeting with Sophie was a "date" of some kind. He mentions the wedding provision and says he's thinking about marrying Emily. He loves her and thinks this could be a sign. She is opposed and wants them to discuss it later.

Before the reading Ashley (on Victoria's orders) tells Emily about the terms of the trust.

Treadwell arrives and tells Victoria about his meeting with Amanda. We flash back to an interview with the Graysons. When he begins to ask about Daniel, Conrad stops the interview. He tells them he's printing the story and has nothing to lose. Victoria stops him and says "perhaps there is an arrangement to be made." In present day Victoria threatens to expose him if he turns on her.

During the reading Treadwell mentions his interviews with young Amanda. Ultimately he confirms what was in his book, to the displeasure of Emily and Nolan.

Emily tells Nolan she never thought Treadwell would come clean. She says she needs him to take Treadwell to dinner and talk about him writing Nolan's biography.

After Nolan and Treadwell leave for dinner Emily shows up outside Treadwell's home in traditional "breaking and entering" garb.

Huntley thinks Victoria should give Daniel her blessing to marry Emily. He reminds her that rushing into a marriage may not be the best recipe for a successful one.

Jack apologizes to Amanda and says he should have followed her lead and tried to have more fun. He wants them to go to Atlantic City.

Emily breaks into Treadwells stash of interview tapes. She flashes back to weeping while reading his book when she was a girl. Young Amanda was so upset she set the picture of her father on fire. In present day Emily sets a lit cigarette on the lone copy of his memoires. She walks away as his cottage burns.

Nolan and Treadwell come home to find his home ablaze. He drops to his knees and weeps.

Emily drops by to see Daniel, wearing lingerie under a trench coat.

The next morning Emily goes through the tapes she stole from Treadwell. She plays one of her father telling Treadwell about being in love with Victoria. David tells Treadwell in the interview that Charlotte is his child.

description: Emily's plan to blow up Victoria and Conrad's marriage goes off the rails, creating collateral damage of everyone close to her.
tags: ['latex gloves', 'love declaration', 'paternity', 'kneeling', 'beating', 'bare chested male']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Emily is showing Nolan the footage from her father that indicates Charlie is her half-sister. She tells him she's going to use the tape to submarine Victoria's divorce, and frame Amanda to get her out of the picture.

Daniel gives Victoria and Huntley inside information about Conrad's business. She thinks that this means he doesn't "have to" marry Emily. Daniel is upset she doesn't respect his happiness.

Emily takes Amanda to breakfast after she returns from Atlantic City. She tells Amanda that she needs to lay low on the heels of Treadwell's house burning down. But Amanda has no interest in leaving town.
