Conrad asks Declan if he'd like to join Charlie at her prep school. If he can get his grades up and pass the entrance examine Conrad will pay the tuition. Conrad gets an envelope with a note inside that says "open in private."

When Huntley begins to talk about Conrad's shady finances, Conrad shows video of David Clarke talking about Charlotte being the name of his favorite aunt. Conrad's attorney say they will be ordering a paternity test and if Charlie turns out not to be Conrad's daughter, the only way she will avoid public humiliation is to take whatever he gives her in settlement.

Huntley is upset that Victoria didn't tell him everything. She thinks the fire at Treadwell's must have been the work of Amanda.

Conrad takes one of Charlie's hairbrushes out of her room.

Emily goes looking for Amanda and Jack tells her about being summed to the Grayson's place. Emily is realizing how much Jack cares about her.

Victoria confronts Amanda about her recalling an affair with David Clarke. Amanda denies any knowledge of the tape that Conrad has and storms out. When she leaves Huntley appears and sticks a cup she was drinking out of into a plastic bag. Victoria doesn't think Amanda is really David Clarke's daughter and this is her way to prove it. Huntley tells Victoria that preliminary results indicate Conrad is not Charlie's father.

Daniel tells Ashley that he's going to propose to Emily. Ashley doesn't seem enthusiastic.

Conrad tells Huntley he's not to going to tamper with Charlie's trust fund and wants to go to trial. He asks for a private meeting with Victoria where he tells her the choices are to either accept his small divorce offer or have the world think her daughter is related one of the world's most hated men. Ashley has eavesdropped on the porch and overheard this.

Amanda tells Jack about the meeting with Victoria and tells him Emily warned her that it might happen. Nolan takes Amanda aside and tells her not to tell Jack too much.

Conrad tells Charlie he thinks "it's best" if she goes back to live with her mother. He blames his work. When she says she can't stand Victoria, he tells her to grow up.

Daniel proposes to Emily in the middle of a torrential downpour on a boat. She says yes.

Daniel and Emily run inside and tell Victoria the news. She grudgingly says "congratulations."

Ashley complains to Nolan about how rough her life has been, in the process telling both he and Jack that Emily and Daniel are engaged. A shady-looking guy hits on Amanda while she is tending bar.

Daniel tells Conrad about being engaged. Conrad thinks this is part of a scheme, but Daniel assures him that he is in love. Conrad warns him that falling in love doesn't prevent the woman you love from keeping massive secrets. Conrad wants Victoria to tell him what he's talking about.

Charlie comes to Emily's place and tells her that out of nowhere Conrad kicked her out of the house. She tells her Conrad looked at her the way he looks at Victoria. Charlie notices the ring and says she's always wanted a sister.

Huntley tells Victoria the DNA results showed Amanda is definitely the half-sister of Charlie. Victoria is shocked. She then fires him as her attorney.

Jack catches the guy from the bar going through Amanda's stuff in the apartment above the bar. Jack tries to stop him and takes a severe beating.

Nolan goes to see Emily. He tells her about Jack's beating and blames her for what happened.

We see Emily meet with Huntley. He says that Victoria "called in her own guy" and he couldn't control it. It was he that switched the DNA samples for her. He thinks her father is innocent but says he can't be part of this kind of violence.

Emily goes to see Jack. She apologizes to his unconscious body.

Emily meets with Amanda. She tells Amanda that the Graysons framed her father and that they were responsible for the plan going down. She says she's returned to avenge her father's death and take everything away from Victoria and Conrad. She says Victoria hired the guy who beat up Jack and that she needs to save herself. Emily gives her a new cell phone and new fake ID and passport again. She says she'll say good-bye to Jack for her.

Victoria tells Daniel that Conrad isn't Charlie's father. She tells him it is actually David Clarke and she was trying to protect Charlie from the truth. Daniel says "What did he do to you mom?" All she says is that she can't talk about it and begins to cry. Daniel comforts her.

Emily tells Nolan that she needs to "minimize the fallout from what I'm doing." She thinks she needs to regroup, wondering if there is a better way to bury Victoria besides marrying Daniel. She's thinking about giving back the ring.

Declan tells Jack that Amanda is gone. He gives him a note. We see that underneath the bed is an interview tape missed by the thug who had broken in.

Charlie returns to Victoria's house but doesn't want to talk to her mother. Victoria flashes back the night before they are to give their statements. She asks if he'll stay with her that night.

Daniel tells Emily that Charlie's father is the "madman, terrorist" David Clarke. He adds "that bastard forced himself on her." Daniel thinks that Victoria was raped and tells Emily that "if that bastard wasn't rotting in hell I'd track him down and kill him myself." Emily then suggests June for weather, saying she wants to marry into his crazy family "more than ever." She glares up at a watching Victoria on the balcony across the dunes as the episode ends.

description: Daniel and Emily plan an engagement party; Victoria uses Conrad's father against him; Jack spirals after Amanda disappears; Charlotte finds herself tangled in a web of deceit.
tags: ['party', 'telephone', 'cell phone', 'laptop computer', 'latex gloves', 'paternity', 'inheritance']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Everyone is opening their ornate invitations to Emily's and Daniel's official engagement party which Victoria is calling a "Fire & Ice Ball."

Victoria is watching an old Daniel Clarke interview when Charlotte comes into the room. She says she's pleased to have her daughter back and expresses hope that the engagement won't result in a wedding.

Emily looks at more video of David Clarke talking about being Charlotte's father. Nolan calls and he thinks they should be holding back. She tells him that her plan is to go public with Charlotte's paternity, and wants to do it "my way." She places a DVD of the interview into a package addressed to Charlotte "from Amanda Clarke." Emily looks at Amanda's cell phone and sees seven missed calls from Jack.

Jack is still recovering from his beating. He asks Nolan if he knows where Amanda might have gone. He wants to get in touch with her and let her know the reason he was beaten up wasn't her fault. Under his bed he finds one of Mason Treadwell's interview tapes labeled "Interview 14: Amanda Clarke."

Conrad and Daniel have lunch. They start to talk about David Clarke and what Victoria has "been through" when Conrad's father, Grandpa Grayson (William Devane), arrives. Apparently Victoria called him to let him know about the divorce. Grandpa tells Conrad he's worried what a messy split could do their company.

Jack leaves Amanda yet another voicemail, this one letting her know about the tape. He said he wants answers and the only way she'll get the tape back is if she meets with him.

Nolan and Emily talk about how Jack could have gotten the tape. She's not sure what it may contain and how much damage it could do.

Prior to an engagement photo shoot Victoria asks Ashley about her relationship with her family. Ashley thinks growing up without great parents can help a kid be more resilient. Victoria says she wants to go to lunch with Charlotte and Declan. Daniel tells Victoria it's not fair to keep Charlotte in the dark about her father. Victoria says it needs to be handled delicately. While Emily and Daniel pose for their photo, Emily flashes back to the first time she, as a bookish-looking, dark-haired college student, first saw him. She overheard Daniel telling another girl about being "weighed down" by his family.

Conrad shows up and has a word with Victoria. He yells at her for calling Grandpa. She tells him that if he wants her to behave at dinner that night he has to promise to be nice to Charlotte and never reveal her true father.

Nolan tries to get the tape from Jack when he asks about how to play it. Jack hangs on to it, telling him to find a player.

Victoria invites Daniel and Emily to dinner with Grandpa. Emily gets a call from Nolan. He says he might be able to find a degaussing device that could ruin it. She thinks the tape is an interview she gave when she was ten.

Amanda calls Jack. She's short with him and tells him to come to a hotel room in the nearby town of Riverhead and bring the tape. Emily is with her. She tells Amanda that they can't let whatever's on that tape lead him to Victoria. Amanda wants to tell Jack everything, but Emily says that Jack won't forgive her if he realizes she's been pretending to be someone else.

Victoria has lunch at the bar with Charlotte and Declan. Charlotte asks if she can invite Declan to dinner that night, but Victoria doesn't think it's a good idea.

Conrad asks Ashley if she's trying to work some opportunist angle. He says she's with the wrong Grayson if that's her game. He tries to appeal to Ashley's unhappiness as Victoria's overqualified Errand Girl, but Ashley doesn't bite.

Jack shows up at Amanda's door furious, but she remains cold. He pushes his way in and demands answers. She vaguely tells him the truth is that she's pretended to be something that she's not and that the little girl he fell in love with is gone. She again demands the tape. He says no and leaves. Emily appears from another room and tells her to go after him. "No!" Amanda says defiantly. "I don't care what's on that tape. I'm not doing that to him again!" "Amanda," Emily tries to convince her, but it's no use. "Stop calling me that!" she snaps, then walks away.

Later, Nolan shows Emily the degausser that will destroy all information on the tape. He continues to pester her about not telling Jack the truth. She says her plan is to use Victoria's lies against her with Grandpa.

Declan meets Grandpa, who tells him he succeeded without a flashy education. Emily is then introduced. She flashes back to more of her first meeting with Jack, when she advised him to be better than his parents in order to get beyond his last name. Conrad shows up and calls Charlotte into the study with him.

Grandpa asks Victoria to promise him the divorce won't get ugly.

Jack comes to Nolan, as his only real friend, to help him view the tape. Nolan is touched by this. He asks Jack why he wants to watch the tape at all. He says if he's going to let her go, "I have to know." Instead of degaussing it, Nolan puts the tape into a player, and we see an interview with a very young Emily, talking about her father kissing Victoria on the lips "all the time." A distraught-looking Jack walks away.

Conrad apologizes to Charlotte for how he's been acting towards her. She reminds him of a story when he made her laugh after she was dumped by a first love. She says "as long as I have you, there's nothing I can't handle." They hug and Emily witnesses the embrace. Emily goes to retrieve the package containing the DVD for Charlotte that she'd had delivered to the Grayson home. When she grabs it, Victoria startles her, causing her to drop it. When Victoria picks it up, Emily quickly takes it, claiming it was a DVD from another wedding planner. "I wouldn't want Ashley to get the wrong idea," she says as she hastily shoves it into her purse.

Jack goes back to Amanda's Hotel and tries to get Amanda to come to the door. He says after seeing the tape he's not surprised she wanted to burn down the house. An emotional Amanda calls Emily and tells her about him seeing the tape. Amanda says she's going after Jack. Emily tries to reason with her, but she says she's done listening to her. We see her just miss him driving away.

At dinner Grandpa tells Emily she reminds him of Victoria. A distraught Jack bursts into the dinner and confronts Victoria about her relationship with David Clarke. He says that she did nothing to prevent Amanda's troubled life. He shows her the tape and says if she doesn't stop telling lies about Amanda he's going to start telling the truth about her. After Jack leaves Grandpa asks if what he said was true. This leads to Daniel talking about the "rape," and Conrad revealing that David Clarke is Charlotte's biological father. She leaves the table in tears and Victoria tells Conrad she'll never forgive him. Conrad reveals to everyone that Victoria had an "ongoing" affair with David Clarke and Daniel learns his mother lied about being raped.

Grandpa and Conrad argue about what happened the last time David Clarke's name was linked to the company. Grandpa thinks that Conrad should step down as CEO and start grooming Daniel to take over.

Emily calls Jack to make sure he's okay. He hasn't spoken with Amanda yet. Daniel tells Emily he feels foolish for defending his mother.

Declan tries to comfort Charlotte. She goes for the booze and he tries to stop her. But she's convinced Conrad will stop being her father now.

Emily yells at Nolan about letting Jack see the tape. She walks in her front door and sees that someone has gotten into her private floor safe. Her secret box is gone! All that's left is an R.S.V.P. card for the "Fire & Ice Ball" with the name Emily Thorne on it and "Will Attend" double underlined.

description: Emily and Daniel's engagement party turns to terror when her vendetta takes a dark, unexpected turn, putting those she loves and hates in mortal danger.
tags: ['translator', 'translation', 'interpreter', 'japanese', 'party', 'beach', 'chaos', 'homosexual', 'underwear', 'boxer shorts', 'undressing', 'loyalty', 'brother brother relationship', 'bare chested male', 'gay']
synopsis_with_character_names:
It's Labor Day weekend, the official end of Summer in The Hamptons. A male body in a white dinner jacket is lying face down on the beach. A hand removes a piece of paper and a handgun is fired... several times. The scene seems eerily familiar, and we realize that the narrative is back to where it all started, months earlier, before the various players and their intricately connected relationships were known.

But first...

24 Hours Earlier

Emily and Nolan discuss who could have broken into her under the floor hiding place and stolen her box. She places a call and reaches Tyler, who taunts her as he is sitting with the box. He says if she does anything rash like cancel the engagement party he'll kill Amanda. We see that he has her gagged and bound on a chair.

Jack and Declan argue over Charlie getting drunk at the bar and Jack's relationship with Amanda. Jack gets a message from someone in Port-au-Prince about doing some work down there.

Conrad tells Victoria about Grandpa wanting to oust him from the board. He mentions her safety net (Daniel) storming out and she promises he'll be back.

Daniel tells Emily he doesn't want to talk to his father. He wants to cancel the party but she talks him out of it. He makes her promise they'll have no secrets. He goes to bed and she gets her handgun from a safe and slips it into a thigh holster.

Amanda tells Tyler that Emily isn't a good person. He responds by telling her that Emily framed her for the fire. He shows her some of the information from Emily's box.

Declan tells Charlie he wants her to get some help. She finds Jack's prescription for Oxycodone. She agrees to see a therapist.

Emily mentions to Ashley about Daniel wanting to cancel the party. Victoria tells Emily that blood is thicker than water, meaning that regardless of whether they get married she'll always be his mother. She wants Emily to help her reconcile with her son.

Emily gets a call from Tyler. He says if she brings money to a certain parking lot he'll give back her "box of secrets." And after that transaction Amanda is "all yours."

Daniel tells Grandpa about Charlie's trouble. Grandpa wants Daniel to help convince Takeda to keep his money with the family business. Takeda is coming to the party and has requested a meeting with Daniel.

Jack tells Declan he feels his life is off track and needs to leave town to get things in order. He plans to be gone for a few months.

Grandpa tells Charlie he thinks therapy does more harm than good. He's particularly worried about news of Victoria's affair with David Clarke leaking. When Charlie sounds set on getting help anyway, he tells her that Declan flunked his admission exam and needs help getting into school.

Emily sneaks up behind Tyler with her gun drawn. She cuffs him and examines the contents of the box. He starts talking about telling Amanda everything Emily has done to her as Amanda sneaks up from behind with her handgun which she had placed down to handle the box. Amanda uncuffs Tyler and they leave together after Emily shows proof the money he had demanded had been wired to an off-shore account. Tyler further taunts Emily, saying he's heard there will be "fireworks" at the party.

Jack tells Emily about leaving. Jack wants her to watch his dog while he's gone. Nolan thinks Emily should follow him. She assures him she can't and makes him promise to make sure Jack gets on the boat.

Conrad gives Victoria the deed to Grayson manor but won't give over the shares. He promises to give her an equal cash value, but wants Daniel to take over.

Daniel calls Emily and tells her about the meeting with Takeda.

At the meeting, Daniel tells Takeda that he can't in good conscience advise him to keep his money with Grayson Global since he himself is leaving. Daniel says he plans to ask his fianc√© to run away with him the following day. Takeda calls Emily afterwards.

Amanda asks Tyler why he's so obsessed with going after Emily. He tells her he thinks Emily killed Frank and plans to get even by killing Daniel and framing Emily for the murder.

Before the party Victoria tells Conrad "it's time to end this" and signs the agreement. Once he leaves she looks down at the business card of a SEC Field Director named John McGowen.

Emily tells Daniel about Victoria wanting her to get them back together.

Amanda sticks the electronic funds tranfer in her pocket and tries to leave. She tells Tyler she's not going to the party and he pulls out Emily's handgun. She manages to hit in him face and run out the door as he fires a shot in her direction.

Victoria tells Daniel she loved David Clarke. He says he's done with her and is moving to Paris with Emily. She realizes that he hasn't told Emily yet. Victoria thinks Emily won't want to give up the Grayson name and tells him to prepare for Emily not being interested in his plan.

We see Jack preparing to set sail. Nolan has planted a minature surveillance camera in the boat's rigging and is watching remotely from his laptop.

Takeda gives Emily a gift at the party. It is her box. He tells her to leave and bury her father's secrets. When she returns, he says, her questions will be answered.

Amanda catches Jack on the dock before he can leave. She wants him to take her, promising that if he does she'll tell him everything and never leave him again.

Daniel tells Emily about his plans to move to France. She's doesn't seem enthusiastic and he's convinced this means Victoria was right.

Amanda tells Jack before they leave she needs to give the waiting taxi driver money (uh oh). She tells him she loves him and they kiss. When she walks away he notices blood on his hand and yells for her, but she gets into the taxi and leaves.

Back in the party Emily tells Ashley she and Daniel are having a spat. Nolan assures her that Jack is gone.

Tyler approaches Daniel on the beach with his handgun drawn. Tyler tells Daniel that Emily has been playing him. He grabs Daniel's cell and tells them they should take a walk.

Back in the party Charlie blows off Victoria. Victoria says she wants to show Emily her gratitude for talking some sense into Daniel about the Paris idea. Emily gets a text from Daniel's cell phone saying he wants to talk to her down on the beach.

Jack goes after Amanda. He hears shots and runs down to the beach. He finds Tyler's body on the beach and Amanda standing over him. Jack tells her to leave and tries to drag Tyler's body into the dunes. Amanda tries to leave in Jack's car.

Victoria grabs the microphone and addresses the party. Emily calls Daniel's cell phone, which rings on Tyler's body. This alerts Charlie and Declan in their underwear playing in the surf that somebody is nearby and Jack has to run away. Victoria publically approves of Emily just as there are screams from the beach. Everyone rushes towards the beach as Amanda get picked up from Jack's car which she couldn't start, by Takeda. It is Tyler on the sand. Daniel walks towards the group, looking confused and with blood on his suit. Victoria rushes to embrace her son. She whispers tersely in his ear, "don't say a word!"

description: The Graysons unite to protect Daniel in the face of the murder scandal at the Fire & Ice party.
tags: ['trial', 'jail', 'prison']
synopsis_with_character_names:
All of the principles are simultaneously speaking with various Southampton Police about the events surrounding Tyler's death. Emily says that when she went home for Daniel's clothes she noticed her gun was missing.

Daniel isn't being charged with anything yet and the family is allowed to take him home. Daniel is going to home with Emily but wants a word with Victoria alone before they leave.

Emily tells Nolan she's worried Tyler told Daniel everything. Daniel glares in her direction while she talks to Victoria.

On the way home Daniel said he just wanted to clear the air with Victoria. Emily asks him what happened on the beach. Daniel flashes to Tyler showing him Emily's revenge list but tells her "I don't remember."

Conrad and Victoria want Charlie to stay at the home, but she's headed back to Declan's place. Ashley is put to work helping the family handle the case.

Jack returns home to find Declan waiting in his room. Declan is very suspicious of where he's been. Declan tells him what happened with Tyler and seeing a suspicious hoodie-wearing person on the beach.

Emily returns home to find Daniel looking through her box. She denies any knowledge of it. He tells her Tyler said she'd been "playing" him and had secrets hidden under the floor. Emily tells Daniel that Tyler was crazy and reminds him the deceased had held them at gunpoint. He seems to settle down and she comforts him.

An attorney named Brooks (Courtney B. Vance) tells Victoria, Daniel and Emily that not much will happen until the Coroner's report comes back.

Victoria isn't pleased that Conrad skipped the meeting with Brooks. He flashes back to the moments after the plane crash. Conrad told Victoria that he was responsible for the crash, that he has been laundering money for the group that claimed responsible. He told her life as they know it over. In present day he tells her they're in another tough spot.

Jack stops by Emily's place to see how she's doing. They talk about Daniel and Declan and Jack asks about Amanda. He says her phone is disconnected.

Nolan opens up the video footage from his surveillance cam on Jack's boat to show Emily what happened. They see Amanda show up.

Declan spots a frantic Charlie taking a pill of some kind. He wants her to talk to a psychiatrist and wonders if she was high the other night. She leaves.

Daniel tells Emily he should have gone to Paris. The police knock on the door with a warrant to arrest Daniel for Tyler's murder. They take him into custody.

Brooks tells the family that there is damning physical evidence stacked up against Daniel. Conrad thinks it's time he tells them what happened. He says that Tyler charged him, he fired once and then blacked out. Brooks points out that Tyler was shot three times, one in the chest and twice in the back. Daniel can't say for certain what happened after he blacked out. But since Daniel has a wound on the back of his head, Brooks think they can use that to offer a defense that a third party hit him from behind. He asks who might want to hurt Daniel and Victoria mentions Amanda.

Jack finds a shirt and some paper in his car.

Victoria pays Emily a visit and says she'd understand if Emily was reconsidering the marriage. Emily says leaving Daniel never crossed her mind. Victoria asks why Emily came back to the house when they were all at the police station and Emily says it was to get a change of clothes for Daniel.

Jack shows Nolan a receipt for a $5 million bank deposit he found in Amanda's jacket in his car. Jack says he followed her to the beach but couldn't find her. Nolan calls Emily and leaves her a message that they need to talk.

Charlie doesn't like what she's reading about her brother online. She asks about David Clarke and wants to know what he was like. Victoria flashes back to being with David on the beach and talking about leaving Conrad. There just doesn't seem to be a way for them to be together. In present day Victoria asks for Charlie to try and remember details.

An alarned Nolan tells Emily about Jack finding the wire receipt. Brooks drops by Emily's place to talk about Daniel. He wants to make sure he's completely prepared for anything that could come up. She tells him she just met Amanda that Summer and doesn't know whether she's capable of framing Daniel. Brooks' investigators are tracking Amanda. Emily tells him there is something he should know about the Graysons.

Brooks asks Victoria and Conrad about paying off a judge to downgrade Daniel's DUI. Emily admits that she was the one who told Brooks and the lawyer thinks she's the only one who is putting Daniel's best interests first. Victoria promises to be more candid with Brooks in the future. Brooks tells them the security tapes from the party were tampered with, kept on a three-minute loop. This will be used against Daniel.

Emily confronts Nolan about working for Takeda. She thinks the security tape tampering reeked of Takeda. He admits Takeda wanted him to look out for her.

Ashley tells the press the Graysons are offering a $100,000 reward for information leading to the third party on the beach. After hearing this on TV Declan goes into one of Jack's drawer and pulls out a bloody sweatshirt.

Charlie pays Emily a visit. Emily asks her about the pills.

Declan shows Jack the sweatshirt he found. He says he's not sure who Jack is protecting, but as of that point Declan will no longer protect him.

The next day Brooks drops by Jack's bar and introduces himself. He asks about Amanda and where Jack was on Saturday night. Brooks leaves his card and tells him to call if he hears from Amanda. After Brooks leaves Jack tells Nolan he needs to find Amanda before the Graysons do.

Ashley tells Brooks she thinks Daniel shot Tyler and will probably get away with it. Brooks tells her if she continues to perform well in front of the camera she'll be able to parlay this case into a new career.

Victoria and Conrad share a drink and laugh at how far their life has fallen. She tells him she's worried about Daniel and says she doesn't think he'd do well in jail.

In court for his arraignment, the sitting judge (Veronica Cartwright) denies Daniel bail, remanding him to the maximum-security facility on Riker's Island.

Jack tells Nolan he's not going to skip town, which Nolan thinks is a mistake. Jack thinks Declan needs him. Nolan places a call and asks about some photos.

Nolan calls Ashley to the bar and tells her he's learned the photos of Daniel being leaked to the media came from her. He is the only one who knows, "for now."

48 Hours Earlier:

Emily rushes to her house from the homicide scene on the beach. Takeda is there and he tells her "You should have heeded my warning." They struggle and he blames her lack of discipline for what took place. She asks what happened on the beach and he shows her the revenge list that Tyler showed to Daniel. Flash back to Takeda watching Daniel and Tyler struggle with Daniel shooting Tyler once in the chest. Takeda knocks Daniel out with a rock to the back of the head, then finishes off the still-alive Tyler. Takeda tells her that he's taken care of Amanda and "the other boy" she has feelings for. Emily then grabs her box out of the floor and smashes it.

An entire month will pass before we learn what transpires next.

description: With the murder suspect in jail, the defense team are searching for ways to implicate someone else. Charlotte's credibility as a witness is called into question. Meanwhile, Victoria reconnects with an old flame.
tags: ['slapped in the face', 'mother slaps her daughter', 'shower', 'jail', 'trial', 'beating', 'prison', 'towel', 'bloody nose', 'bare chested male', 'abuse']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Daniel is on Riker's Island, writing a letter to Emily explaining that he's not guilty.

Nolan drops by to see Emily and sees the letter from Daniel. She admits that she had lost focus and got too involved.

Victoria is trying to get Charlie to tell a sketch artist what the hooded person on the beach looked like. Declan drops by for orientation and is grilled as well.

There are still no leads as to the location of "Amanda Clarke." Victoria is adamant they spare no expense tracking her down. Attorney Brooks tells Victoria and Conrad they need to find another viable suspect. Victoria hints at lying about what Charlie saw on the beach.

Nolan wants Jack to give up on "Amanda." He's not ready to do that, given the blood he found in her jacket.

Brooks tells everybody that Daniel won't be getting bail. Victoria shows them a sketch that looks quite a bit like Jack. She and Emily exchange steely glances.

Victoria, Conrad and Emily decide hiring a spin doctor would be a good idea. Emily says she'll look into Mason Treadwell.

Victoria calls Lee, the shady young man she'd previously used to break into Jack's to steal the Treadwell tapes. She ask about getting a "message" to someone inside Riker's.

Emily asks Nolan to find Treadwell. He tells her about Jack and she thinks he should send him out of town on an "Amanda" hunt.

Emily meets with Daniel in prison. He's having a rough go of it. She gives him some advice about how to handle being inside.

Nolan meets with Treadwell, who says he'll never write again. He blames "Amanda" for what happened to his home. Nolan tells him about Daniel's arrest and the potential connection to "Amanda."

Treadwell meets with Victoria, telling her that the sketch doesn't mean all that much. Victoria offers him exclusive access and wants him to begin blogging about the case online immediately. Ashley has already set him up with a domain name. [thetreadwellreport.com]

Daniel is jumped in the prison shower and severely beaten by several men.

On Riker's the following day Emily and Victioria are told that Daniel sustained a concussion and a number of broken bones. Victoria immediately reminds everyone that the judge had promising to revisit Daniel's incarceration if he was in danger. Brooks says the judge is looking at house arrest and Daniel could be home the next day.

Treadwell stops by Jack's bar and tells him about the eyewitnesses placing him on the beach. Treadwell wonders if "Amanda" put him up to it and Jack throws the smarmy weasel out. Declan follows Treadwell from of the bar and tells him Jack is being set-up, adding that Charlie was on painkillers the night of the murder and doesn't remember anything.

Emily follows Victoria as she meets and pays off Lee who had arranged for Daniel to be beaten, and takes a number of photos of the exchange with her cell' 'phone. Victoria then meets up with a man who knows her as "Vicki Harper."

Emily breaks into a safe.

Treadwell wants to talk to Charlie, using her prescription pills as leverage to get her to open up. He tells her "you don't have to be like the rest of your family."

Nolan tells Jack that "Amanda" hasn't withdrawn any of the money in the account. He tells him that perhaps "Amanda" is waiting for him in Montreal and he should go find her.

Victoria and the "new" man speak post-coital. He is your garden variety starving artist, complete with an accent, who seems to be an old love.

While working on his blog Treadwell gets an IM from somebody who says he knows who burned his house. They tell him to check the drawer, where he finds his tapes. He thinks he's chatting with "Amanda." The person tells him Victoria has the answers. Of course we see that it was the real Amanda, Emily.

Lying in bed Victoria and her artist catch up on old times. She checks in by 'phone with Conrad, who tells her that Daniel is being released on $10 million bail and is on his way home followed by the press.

Daniel is set up at home with his ankle monitor. He's told that if he violates his house arrest perimeter he'll go back to prison.

Charlie is furious with Declan for selling her out to Treadwell. His latest blog post reports that Declan says Charlie was under the influence of champagne and painkillers and invented the person she saw on the beach. He tells her that eventually she'll understand, but she doesn't care, saying "it's time for your exit. She hangs up and takes another pill.

Victoria arrives home to find out about Declan talking to Treadwell. The story has gone viral and now the family is in doubt. Emily confirms having seen Charlie with pills and Brooks says Charlie is no longer a viable witness. Daniel's entire defense is now shot.

Charlie admits to Victoria that she's high. Victoria slaps her as Conrad comes to the door, saying she may have doomed her brother.

Jack tells Declan he's headed to Montreal. Nolan is helping run the bar in his absence. After Jack leaves Nolan says he knows what Declan is doing, and that Jack doesn't realize his brother is protecting him with his statement to Mason.

Treadwell tells Victoria he saw right through her plan and wasn't interested in helping her frame an innocent man. When she demands he run a retraction, he says he knows she burned down his home and has his tapes. She says it was "Amanda" and he threatens to "burn you at the stake" if she brings Amanda Clarke into the case.

Wearing a brown wig, Emily picks up Lee in the same bar she'd followed Victoria to the night she arranged for her son's beating. She surreptitiously records their conversation while going shot-for shot of booze with Lee.

Victoria tells Daniel "all this will be over soon." She brings up the idea that Emily was the one who finished the job, asking how he knows that Emily wasn't there. He says that if she tries to bring Emily into his defense as an alternative killer, he'll confess to everything.

Emily suggests she and the guy leave the bar together as Daniel is trying to reach her on the phone.

Online Victoria reads about her artist, Dominik Wright, whose career fell apart over drug and forgery charges. He calls her, asking if they'll ever see each other again. When Conrad enters the room she hangs up on him. Conrad tells her she needs to be discreet with any affairs. She accuses him of directing Treadwell to the tapes. He calls her delusional. Victoria returns to Dominik.

Emily surprises Lee in the parking lot with a rapid series of strikes and kicks. He is unable to effectively defend himself, and is beaten to the ground. Emily tells his barely conscious form: "This is for Jack... and that was for Daniel."

She obtains an impression of the helpless Lee's key before leaving.

description: Shocking events unfold at Daniel's trial as allegiances are tested, secrets are revealed, friendships begin to fray, and a revelation creates a change in Emily's quest for revenge.
tags: ['prison', 'blackmail', 'jail', 'justice', 'drinking', 'drug trade', 'handcuffs', 'theft', 'father figure', 'brother brother relationship', 'infidelity']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Emily is sitting in the courtroom of Daniel's trial as Tyler's murder in being reenacted.

Charlie is the defense's surprise witness.

Jack calls Nolan at the bar from outside of Boston, where he is searching for Amanda. Jack tells Nolan to keep Declan from talking to anybody until he returns.

Defense Attorney Brooks tells the family his strategy is to paint Daniel in a sympathetic light and wants to open by putting Emily on the stand. Victoria doesn't love the idea. Brooks says the DA's office feels so strongly about its case that it's no longer offering Daniel a deal.

Emily shows Nolan the bugs she has in the Grayson home as Victoria is speaking with Lee about tampering with a few jury members.

Jack returns home. Declan notices the blood-stained hoodie and says he wants to tell the police

Dominik tells Victoria he's getting sniffs from art dealers regarding his work.

Jack shows up at Emily's place. She tells him she hasn't heard from Amanda. He says he thinks Amanda is in trouble and Emily suggests he keep looking.

Daniel tells Victoria that based on his past he is expecting to be found guilty. When he leaves Victoria calls Brooks to tell him he should subpoena Jack as a hostile witness.

Charlie is still taking her pills. Victoria tells her to "find a way" to get Declan to corroborate her story.

Juror No. 3 is visited by Victoria's henchman Lee. He says if she doesn't hang the jury he'll kill her son, and shows her a photo as proof of his ability to get new to the young boy.

Emily tells Nolan his job is to make sure Declan sticks to his story.

Charlie goes to see Declan in a fancy dress. She tells him this is the chance for him to fix "everything, including you and me." All he has to do is tell the truth. Nolan interrupts and Declan tells him that he simply can't lose his brother.

In court the following day Declan is on the stand. He is asked about Charlie's statement, and says there was no one else on the beach. He says his testimony is more credible because Charlie was drunk and had been taking pills.

Victoria makes sure to prod Daniel about the fact Emily was sitting next to Jack in court. An angry Daniel calls Emily and tells her he's not sure she's in love with him.

Jack tells Nolan about the evidence in his possession. He wants to turn himself in and asks Nolan to help him. Nolan immediately calls Emily, who wants him to keep him there.

Charlie gets a delivery of Vicodin from Adam, who wants a sexual payment as well as money.

Conrad pays Dominik a visit, referencing both his affair with his wife and his shady past in making forgeries. Dominik says he's been told what Conrad did to David Clarke. Conrad responds by suggesting he clear out and the two exchange nasty words.

Emily breaks into Jack's home looking for the sweatshirt and doesn't find it.

A drunken Daniel staggers into Emily's house and accuses her of sneaking around with Jack, eventually pushing her. The police burst into the room, as Daniel is violation of his house arrest.

Emily tells Victoria about Daniel's accusation and says she's been working with Jack to look into information about Amanda. Emily says she hasn't found anything.

Nolan and Jack return to his place to find it ransacked. Jack realized the hoodie is gone.

In the city Lee being pulled over with Jack's sweatshirt in his possession.

Nolan assures Jack and Declan the Graysons are capable of anything.

Lee calls Victoria from prison. He says that if he's going down he's taking her with him.

Victoria tells Conrad about what she had Lee do, but says she thinks Jack must have set him up. Emily is listening to this conversation. Conrad tells her that Dominik is long-gone by now.

Daniel writes a letter to Emily. He says he's going to everybody a favor "and end this now.'

Brooks is in the Riker's Island facility to confer with Daniel in prison as Victoria goes to see Dominik.

It turns out that Lee has hung himself and confessed to killing Tyler. Daniel's charges could soon by dropped. Dominik seems to have cleared out.

Emily plays Nolan audio of Conrad speaking to somebody in order to set up the Lee murder. In it he references another "David Clarke situation." Emily realizes that the Graysons killed her father.

description: The press becomes increasingly hostile as Daniel's release approaches; Emily discovers a photograph that leads to her to one of her father's allies before his death.
tags: ['drug trade', 'loyalty', 'counterfeit', 'public humiliation', 'father figure', 'gay character', 'locker room', 'father son relationship', 'contraband']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Open with Emily talking, in voice-over, about absolution as she stands alone over her father's grave. She leaves a single rose on the metal plaque marking his resting place before she leaves.

We then see some news reports about Daniel's trial, which is being called a "Trial of the Decade" candidate. A crowd of protesters accusing Daniel of being part of the 1 percent voice their disbelief about the 11th hour confession and suicide that could exonerate the Graysons' heir.

Jack warns Declan about the Graysons knowing he lied on the stand.

Conrad and Victoria bicker about Dominick.

Emily goes to check on Charlie in her room. Charlie has been doing research about her father, David Clarke, and has a number of articles and photos spread out on her bed. She's found a picture of David in the prison yard, taken on the day he died. Emily and Charlie both think he looks scared, and we can see he's writing something in a journal that does not look like the anything inside the "infinity" box, a.k.a the Revenge Chest.

Emily calls Nolan with news that there must be a missing journal. She catches him pulling it out of a safe. He says he was honoring David's wishes by not giving it to her.

Emily reads the journal. He's talking about people plotting his execution as he gets closer to the truth. He writes something about a "CM" who is bringing him information he needs moments before being stabbed by a guard. Emily looks up CM in the Grayson company database and finds an employee named Carole Lynn Miller who died ten years earlier.

Noland assures Jack that Declan should be fine.

Charlie is still getting prescription drugs from Adam. Declan stops by wanting to talk to her but she blows him off.

Emily is looking into Miller's death when Jack drops by. He asks her about the Graysons and whether it's smart to marry into the family. Daniel calls with news: the charges have been dropped.

Victoria meets with an SEC agent and asks for full immunity in exchange for information about a domestic terrorist. He's going to check on what he can offer.

Emily meets Daniel and they leave prison together. Back at home he's greeted by his parents. Daniel is still getting killed in the press, which shows that public opinion very much against him. The plan is to make a huge PR push. Ashley tells Victoria she's been offered a position by Brooks, but Victoria asks her to hang around to serve as media liaison until Daniel's interviews are figured out. As Ashley walks away Victoria wears her telltale menacing smile.

Emily breaks into the hospital and looks at Miller's records. She calls the doctor of record, who says he had a Carole Thomas with a similar background, but says she is very much alive.

Emily goes to see Miller, flashing a Homeland Security badge. Miller was a secretary with Conrad's company. She pulls a shotgun on Emily and we find out this is Nolan's aunt. He tells Miller who Emily really is.

Miller investigated the Grayson's company, ultimately finding out David Clark was innocent. An investigator saved her life by helping fake her death. She recalls a white-haired man whose name she doesn't know, who met with Conrad a number times near the plane crash. Emily doesn't seems upset with Nolan for concealing his family, saying she would have done the same.

Jack confronts Daniel along, and reveals he was the one who dragged Tyler's body up the beach and tells him about the hoodie. He thinks Daniel owes it to Emily to ignore what his parents may be up to.

Declan tells the school about Charlie's drugs, which they find in her locker. She threatens to have her father pull his tuition.

Brooks tells Ashley that her job offer has been pulled. Based on Victoria's suggestion he looked into her background and found out she leaked the picture of Daniel. Brooks explains that he already has problems trusting his clients, and he can't surround himself with employees he can't trust.

Conrad gets word that the SEC has raided his company.

Emily wonders if this interview is an opportunity for Daniel to come clean and separate himself from his family.

Conrad tells Daniel what is happening with their family and Grayson Global while, thanks to a bug in his office, Emily listens in from a remote location. Conrad tells him about Victoria paying somebody to beat him up in prison. He then asks if he's ready to take on his role as the family heir. When Daniel agrees, he tells his son to shut his office doors. Conrad then opens up about everything, starting with David Clarke.

Victoria's found out about Charlie's suspension and the drugs. She wants to help her daughter. Victoria sees the picture of David Clarke that Charlie stole from her.

Before the interview Emily again advises Daniel to come clean. Victoria drops by and takes a couple of shots at Emily. Daniel asks Victoria about the circumstances that led to him being released from prison and placed under house arrest. Before she can answer his interview begins.

Daniel tells the interviewer he understands why people were so upset with him. She brings up the SEC investigation of the Grayson company. As Emily looks on from off camera, Daniel says that his father is the victim of a witch hunt, and he stands by him as a father and business partner.

After the interview Conrad offers Ashley a job at Grayson Global, sealing the deal with the gift of a luxury car.

Declan's tuition has been pulled. Nolan steps in to pay his tuition instead.

Victoria takes Charlie to David Clarke's resting place. Victoria tells her daughter that David Clarke was a good man, and because of him she loves Charlie even more. Then they spot the still relatively fresh rose on David Clarke's grave, indicating somebody has been there recently.

Emily tells Nolan about Conrad confessing everything to Daniel before the interview. She says she's still going to marry him, then she's going to track the people who killed her father and kill them.

In one of the Treadwell videos Emily spots the white-haired man. She recognizes him as the man who killed her father.

description: A flashback to Emily's past before she sought revenge against the Graysons and their accomplices.
tags: ['brother brother relationship', 'jail', 'loyalty', 'party', 'prison', 'in laws', 'father son relationship', 'adolescent']
synopsis_with_character_names:
In December 2002, (real) Amanda (then a brunette) is at a club with a man she ends up beating up in the bathroom. She meets Nolan for what seems to be the second time after he gave her a piece of her company. She hasn't read her faher's journals yet and he tells her she must do it.

Conrad meets with Frank and Victoria. They have received a letter that says "Shame -- David Clarke." Since Clarke's been dead for months, they are treating this like a threat and are inviting anybody who might know what happened to Clarke to a party in an attempt to flush out who is responsible.

Amanda goes to Jack's bar, sees him for the first time and seems to be interested. His girlfriend at the time is one of the bartenders.

Amanda breaks into her old house and has flashbacks to childhood. Her dad is leaving for Conrad's Christmas part with his brother Bill, who gives her a present before the two men leave. Back in present day '02 Amanda finally takes the time to read her father's journals and learns all about what happened to him.

The Davis' arrive to stay with the Graysons. We learn that a dummy corporation owns David Clarke's old house and isn't interested in selling.

Jack and his girlfriend are arguing over money. She wants to make more money and eventually go to Europe, but he's concerned about his father's business. Amanda asks the girlfriend if she can work for her on New Year's Eve.

Victoria sneak off to David Clarke's place. She flashes back to the Christmas party where she met David, a rising star in Conrad's company, for the first time. Conrad find her over there and we learn that the Grayson's own the place and Conrad wants to sell it because he thinks she still loves David. Emily hears all of this.

Emily works the New Year's party. She runs into Treadwell and recognizes him from her childhood. Treadwell tells Victoria he's working on the book about David and gives her the picture of David from the day he was killed. A man named Roger tells Emily he'd like to be seated as far away from the Conrads as possible. She recognizes his name from her father's journal as being "a true friend."

Nolan drops by Jack's bar and the two meet officially.

Amanda finds Roger a bottle of whiskey from Conrad's private stash. She asks him about her father. He wants her to drop it, but she says she isn't afraid of the Conrads.

Flashback to David leaving the Christmas party and says good-bye to Victoria. They talk about their children and appear to be developing a connection.

Conrad and Frank talk about Roger. Conrad talks to Lydia about buying David's home. He mentions that he owns the property and this leads to them fooling around.

A drunken Roger starts speaking a little too freely. He falls into Emily before Frank leads him away.

Nolan talks to Jack's father about his financial issues and the boys' mother not being involved in their lives.

Frank and Roger begin to have strong words about David. Amanda arrives with some aspirin.

Conrad addresses the party and announces that the Davis' will be moving in next door. Victoria looks shocked.

At midnight Jack's girlfriend grabs Nolan and kisses him. Jack punches Nolan.

Lydia and Victoria talk about the home. She tells Lydia that she lied about the home and apologizes. Victoria gives Lydia her blessing.

We see that Roger gave Amanda a piece of paper when he bumped into her. She reads it while watching Roger and Frank through the window. Amanda goes to his rooms and finds him in a bathtub full of blood.

Later in the night we see that Roger is dead and Victoria seems well-aware Frank may have had something to do with the "suicide." Victoria finds out that Treadwell was the one who wrote the note. He did it on purpose to stir the pot.

A sobbing Amanda calls Nolan and tells him about Roger. He warns her she'll never be able to bring the Graysons down. She yells "the hell I won't!"

We hear Roger's note. He said he'd help her, but warned her to stay away from the Graysons.

In present day Daniel comes home from work to Amanda as the blonde Emily.

There is apparently a New Year's Eve party coming up.

description: Emily's search for the white haired man is interrupted by the wedding plans, and now Nolan is going after him. Meanwhile, Sammy seems to be on the final stage of his life.
tags: ['death of an animal', 'death of a dog', 'death of dog', 'death of animal', 'crying man', 'therapy', 'dog', 'blackmail', 'drug trade', 'father son relationship']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Emily is digging what looks like a grave and talking about the stages of grief.

36 HOURS EARLIER

Emily watches video of her father being interviewed. He mentions wanting to make sure his daughter gets the video. Voiceover Emily says grief is a life sentence for her.

Conrad tells Daniel the plan is to use his wedding to help with their PR problems. They also want to make sure Jack doesn't become an issue. Daniel says he has a plan for Jack. A concerned Nolan calls Emily, as both of them have been watching through a hidden camera. The white-haired man comes in to see Conrad and tells him he's becoming a problem to the "initiative." Emily tells Nolan she's going to create a reason for the two to meet, then track the white-haired man and when Nolan asks "What then?" she replies "You already know the answer to that."

Daniel tells Emily he feels like it's his responsibility to help the company by using their wedding. He gets her to agree to sit down with Ashley and talk it over. Emily changes the memory card in a camera hidden in a book.

Victoria tells Charlie she'll be back at school starting in a few weeks. She wants her mother to go to family counseling. Victoria is not all that interested.

Victoria complains to agent McGowan about her husband still not being in prison. He says there isn't enough evidence of a conspiracy. She says she can't handle it on her own.

Daniel gives Jack some money to help with Declan and the bar.

Conrad tells Victoria he knows she was the one who put the SEC on him. She tells him about Charlie's addiction counselor wanting to meet with the entire family. Lydia is now hanging out with Conrad in nighttime lingerie.

Declan studies with a young gal named Jamie from his school. He defends Charlie.

Emily wants Nolan to encrypt a video of her and Daniel sleeping and E-mail it to Conrad. She thinks he'll think the white-haired man is threatening them. Nolan is concerned about how dangerous Conrad is.

Conrad and Lydia playfully hint at a wedding over the phone. Conrad gets the E-mail and immediately calls the white-haired man to set-up a meeting. Emily starts to head out the door, but is trapped when Daniel and Ashley come over for the wedding planning session.

Jack tells Nolan about getting the million bucks from Daniel. He wants to start a charity. Emily calls Nolan and asks him to help her trail the white-haired man and find out where he lives.

Victoria pays Lydia a visit. She tells her about the government's building of a case against Conrad and warns her that that she could be in trouble for perjuring herself all those years ago. Victoria tells Lydia about the fact Conrad is holding on the forgeries from Dominik Wright. She takes a letter opener and slashes one of them.

Emily tells she wants a private wedding. Daniel is irritated that Emily is paying more attention to her cell' 'phone (updates from Nolan) than Ashley's wedding plans for them.

At the meeting Conrad tells the white-haired man that he has evidence that will burn him if he ever threatens to harm his son again. The white-haired man stands up and walks out.

Daniel is furious that Emily keeps checking her 'phone. This leads to an argument about the Graysons. Even Ashley is pissed at Emily.

Declan and Jamie help Jack look for his dog Sammy, who is missing.

Nolan texts Emily the address where the white-haired man is located.

The white-haired man calls someone and tells them "someone's on to us." The doorbell rings and we see that it is Nolan in a fake mustache pretending to be the cable guy. He's given Emily the wrong address.

Emily and Nolan's mother argue over what she's planning and whether David would have approved.

Nolan works on the cable as the white-haired man watches him carefully. The white-haired man asks for a card. He quizzes Nolan before letting him leave.

Conrad returns home to a concerned Lydia. She tells him about the painting and the evidence. There is a letter waiting for Conrad.

Nolan tells Emily that he "gave her options." Emily comes home to find a very sick-looking Sammy on her porch. She calls Jack to let him know.

During the counseling session Conrad says a number of negative things about the entire family. Victoria tells him that Lydia has betrayed him. Charlie is frustrated and walks away.

Jack lays Sammy in front of the fire. Jack is emotional, saying he doesn't think he can say good-bye. Eventually he does and both he and Emily weep. She flashes back to her childhood.

Declan and Jamie return to his place, planning to make some "Lost Dog" signs for Sammy. When Jamie goes to the bathroom a weepy Charlie walks in complaining about her family. She says nice things about him and asks if she can stay the night. Jamie walks out of the bathroom and Charlie jumps to conclusions. The two women bicker and Charlie makes a crack about Declan having skeletons in his closet.

Daniel tells Victoria that if she destroys Conrad "you're dead to me."

Emily and Jack kiss passionately after Sammy dies. Ashley witnesses this through the door.

Jack and Emily have dug a grave for Sammy. Before he goes to get the body he tells her how nice it was to have somebody with him. Jack talks about Sammy leading him to her all those years ago. They don't know what they're going to do. Emily continues to dig, which appears to be what we saw in the opening.

Charlie scores more drugs from her dealer.

With Emily watching via hidden camera, Victoria tells Daniel she agrees to his ultimatum. She gives him the evidence she'd been planning to turn over and tells him "what you chose to do with it is entirely up to you." After his mother leaves Daniel calls Conrad and says "Mom bought it." He'll bring the information to his father in the morning. Victoria hears this call from the hallway.

Jack tells Declan that Sammy is dead.

Nolan calls Emily. She thanks him and says she's "starting to see a light at the end of the tunnel." He shows her that he has video surveillance inside the white-haired man's home.

Daniel returns home and embraces Emily. She apologizes and goes to bed without any word of the suitcase he had in his hands.

Nolan notices that something is wrong with the video feed because the clock in the white-haired man's living room is displaying the wrong time. Just as he starts to figure out that he's watching a video loop instead of a live feed, the white-haired man sneaks up from behind him and chokes him unconscious.

description: Emily intends to finally follow through with her plan for revenge; the Graysons continue down a path of self-destruction; an explosive event changes everything.
tags: ['slapped in the face', 'mother slaps her son', 'bomb', 'blackmail', 'poison', 'execution', 'explosion', 'kidnapping', 'infidelity']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Emily seems to fake a home intrusion in order to cover for stealing the content of Daniel's briefcase. She tells him it was an older man with white hair.

Daniel tells Conrad, who shows his son a video of he and Emily sleeping. Conrad said that with this evidence gone, "I'm a dead man." He orders a sweep of Grayson manor.

Emily can't reach Nolan on his phone.

Jack looks at the check from Daniel and gives Emily a call. She doesn't answer.

Emily finds the back door open at Nolan's place. On a table is Nolan's laptop, open with a picture of sign on the screen. It says "CALL MY CELL OR I DIE." She calls and can see the white haired man answer on the screen. He's in a holding cell of some kind with Nolan. She tells him Nolan's not the one he wants. She tells him her real name and that she knows he killed her father. He agrees they have unfinished business and asks how they should handle it. "Face to face," she says.

Victoria doesn't want to let Conrad search the home. Three microphones are quickly found in his study. Conrad thinks her talks with the SEC are to blame.

Daniel finds a camera in a book in his room.

Emily meets with the white haired man, who immediately pulls a gun on and finds out she's not armed or wired. She tells him about the evidence in her possession about the Initiative's role in carrying out a terrorist plot on U.S. soil. She wants to be taken to Nolan. He demands that she chloroform herself before they leave.

Emily flashes back to childhood and finding an injured bird on the porch. She wakes up handcuffed next to Nolan in the cell. The white haired man threatens to hurt Nolan and she tells him where the evidence is located. The key is on her keychain and she says there is an E-mail programmed to expose him in exactly one hour.

The white haired man leaves to check on the evidence. Emily quickly retrieves a thin piece of metal from the weave of her sweater, picks the lock on her cuffs and lets Nolan free. She is going to stay, while his job is to deliver information to the Feds.

Charlotte is strangely nice to Declan and Jamie. She tells him "I'm happy for you."

Jack shows up at Grayson Global and gives Daniel his check back. After he leaves Ashley hints that she knows something about Jack and Emily, and it looks like she's going to share it.

Charlotte comes home and looks up the number of an investigator. Identifying herself as Victoria, she has the man look into Jamie.

Conrad gives Lydia a ring, calling it a "promise." She accepts.

Nolan plants the evidence in the trunk of SEC investigator McCelan's car.

The white-haired man returns to find Emily sitting in a chair armed with an axe. They fight and eventually Emily gets the upper hand, sitting on top of the man with the axe on his windpipe.

Just as she is about to choke him to death she flashes back to setting the bird free with her father. David told her his favorite thing about her is the way she loves. She lets the white haired man live.

Victoria tells her SEC agent buddy that she can't take credit for the evidence finding its way to him. He tells her that Lydia has recanted her testimony. Victoria is confident she can work on her. The agent then drops the bombshell that Conrad contracted to have David killed.

Emily comes home to a very angry Daniel. He asks her if she kissed Jack and she admits it. She tells him the truth is that "I'm not the person you fell in love with." She points out that he's becoming what he never wanted to be, "a Grayson" and gives back the ring. She apologizes and he leaves.

The white-haired man tells Conrad that he had nothing to do with the evidence finding its way to the SEC. While Emily watches, he tells Conrad he's on his way to the airport and suggests he might want to do the same.

Daniel tells Victoria that he broke things off with Emily. He tells Victoria he didn't turn over the evidence and wants her not to testify. She tells him about Conrad having David murdered. Daniel responds that both of them have done terrible things, but at least Conrad's were in the best interest of the family. She thinks she is finally righting a terrible wrong and "nobody will stand in my way."

Victoria calls Lydia and suggests she rethink aligning herself with Conrad and promises she'll be coming for her after she's done with her husband. Conrad walks into the room and Lydia tells him her father had a heart attack and she needs to go home. He offers to give her a ride or use of his plane, but she declines. He says he understands perfectly and gives her a kiss.

Nolan mentions to Emily that it seems all that is left is Jack. She says she plans to tell him "everything." Emily gives Jack a call and says she'd like to stop by that night. Nolan and Emily toast her father.

Evidence is mailed to everybody in school that Jamie had a relationship with a teacher at her old school. Declan confronts Charlotte, telling her she's just like Victoria, and that he never wants to speak with her again.

Victoria drops by to see Emily and says perhaps now the two of them can move on. When Emily suggests Victoria take back her engagement gift, Victoria tells her to open it. The box was empty and Victoria says she knew that Emily's future with Daniel was as empty as the box.

Emily gives Sam's collar to Jack, prepared to tell him everything. But out of the other room walks Amanda, who is pregnant. She gives a stunned Emily a hug, then says "Jack and I are going to have a baby." Emily says congratulations and leaves quickly. Outside the bar she tries to fight back tears.

Daniel has Ashley over for a drink. She wonder if she made a mistake telling him about observing Emily and Jack, but Daniel is happy he knew the truth sooner rather than later.

Before Victoria leaves for Washington, Charlotte asks her mother if getting retribution ever made her feel better. Victoria said it does when the party deserved it and tells Charlotte to forgive herself and move on.

Conrad bursts through the door and tries to convince Victoria not to testify because of what will happen to their children. When she brings up David's death, he says that order came from far above him. He promises her that if she boards the plane "it will be the last thing you do." She says "then I guess I'll see you in Hell."

Emily tells Nolan about Amanda's pregnancy. He says he's coming over and makes her promise not to do anything "revengey" until he gets there.

Victoria boards the plane. Beneath the jetliner a worker removes the chock from one of the landing gear, and as he leaves, he removes his watch cap. It is the white haired man.

We see Conrad place a picture of Victoria and Lydia in the fire.

Charlotte watches a news report with word that her mother was killed in a plane crash. She calls Declan, who hangs up on her without listening to why she's calling.

Conrad rushes in to find Charotte unconscious with an empty pill vial beside her on her bed, appearing to have died.

Nolan arrives to find Emily beside herself that the evidence that could have exonerated her father was on the plane that just exploded. He tells her that he backed-up and unencrypted the hard drive before turning it over to the SEC. It turns out that after the Graysons framed David, the Initiative handled the cover-up. It goes much deeper than the Graysons. We see video of Victoria referencing that there being "more to the story" of David's wife when they met. Emily asks "what is she saying? that they killed my mother too?" Nolan replies, "No, what she's saying is that uh.. your mother's alive." Emily's mother isn't dead after all. Emily blankly stares at the computer without a single tear dropping and says, "let it play." Scene cuts to black and the first season concludes.

description: Fighting an implacable enemy in Germania, Marcus Aurelius trains his decadent son Commodus to succeed him, while rumor and intrigues brew back in Rome.
tags: ['male wears underwear', 'bare chested male', 'barefoot male', 'forest', 'woods']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Fighting an implacable enemy in Germania, Marcus Aurelius (John Bach) trains his decadent son Commodus (Aaron Jakubenko) to succeed him, while rumor and intrigues brew back in Rome.

End of the 2nd century and Rome is massive and powerful. 20% of Earth's population (50 MM people) lives within Roman boundaries. It is ruled by Emperor Marcus Aurelius. Marcus was considered a successful emperor and a distinguished philosopher. Roads, Aqueducts and sewers made Rome technologically advances and kept the Empire together. Rome was 1 MM people strong and growing. Marcus made the mistake of wanting his decadent son Commodus to succeed him as Emperor rather than adopting someone qualified and trained, as his predecessors had done (as no emperor in the last 80 yrs ever had a son, so they adopted). Commodus was spoiled, engaged in drunken orgies. Faustina (Lisa Chappell), his mother, sends Commodus to Germania to learn discipline from his father.

Germanian tribes were attacking roman boundaries without restraint and had to be stopped. This had been going on for 250 yrs, and a decisive solution was needed. The Roman success lay in getting entrenched and building infra along the front lines, that allowed them to sustain war for prolonged duration. Despite Commodus being irresponsible, Marcus had no hesitation in promoting him at a young age. Marcus was simply not able to see that his son was not upto the task of being a Roman Emperor (Historians debate if it was simply fatherly love or naivete that somehow Commodus would turn out to be a good Emperor). While Commodus is being trained, Germanic tribes band together and attack Roman front lines. Thousands die on both sides. The war keeps dragging on. Marcus falls ill and news is dispatched to Rome. But the message is distorted and the news reaches that Marcus has died. Faustina knows Commodus is not ready for the throne and she has to protect her family. Lucilla (Tai Berdinner-Blades) is Faustina's daughter.

Roman senate is made of the most influential people of the Empire, each ambitious to further their own career. Lucilla was 12 yrs older to Commodus, married to Marcus's top advisor and was jealous of the prominent role being given to Commodus. Faustina decides to withdraw to Egypt. Lucilla knows that Faustina is abandoning her to protect herself and Commodus. Egypt is rich, governed by Avidius Cassius, with an army of 15,000 men. Avidius was a trusted man of Marcus. Faustina reaches Egypt and seduces Avidius. She backs Avidius as the emperor, in exchange for protection for Commodus. Avidius raises as Army of 7 legions (Egypt, Judea, Arabia and Africa) and marches to Rome. It is then revealed that Marcus is still alive in Germania. Avidius has no option but to continue towards Rome. But Faustina decides to visit Marcus at Germania. Faustina maintains that she has been loyal and faithful to Marcus, but he turns his back towards her. Marcus has Avidius assassinated and Faustina poisoned.

Commodus dearly loves his mother and is aghast that Marcus has eliminated her.

description: The Germanic tribes strike as Marcus Aurelius succumbs to disease, leaving a skeptical Emperor Commodus to prosecute a war that doesn't interest him.
synopsis_with_character_names:
The Germanic tribes strike as Marcus Aurelius succumbs to disease, leaving a skeptical Emperor Commodus to prosecute a war that doesn't interest him.

Faustina is cremated. Marcus has been Emperor for 14 yrs now. Marcus wants Commodus back in Rome, but this time Commodus says he wants to stay in Germania. Commodus starts taking his training more seriously. Since the start of the Empire, success of the Emperor depends on his control of the army. Only a skilled warrior can gain the respect of his troops. By having Commodus train in Germania, Marcus ensures that his troops are familiar & comfortable with Commodus. After being trained as a soldier, Commodus returns to Rome with MArcus.

Emperor's needed the Senate to run the empire, administratively. Senate had 600 men, with seats passed down through generations. Senate controls the treasury, conducts trials and advises the Emperor. Cassius Dio (Edwin Wright) and Quintianus serve the Senate under Marcus. Marcus needs more funds to continue the Germanic campaign. Cassius and Quintianus support Marcus's request for more funds to maintain their own position in Rome. Next, Marcus needs to find a Queen for Commodus. Marcus selects Bruttia Crispina (Ella Becroft), born into ROme's most influential family. She is the daughter of Marcus's advisor, a man who has been consul twice. This way, after MArcus is dead, Commodus will still have support amongst the Senators of Rome. But this match comes in the way of Lucilla's ambitions. The wedding takes place with great pomp and splendor.

But while Marcus and Commodus are away, the war in Germania escalates and German tribes break through Roman defenses. Pertinax was in command in Marcus's absence. Marcus is forced to return to Germania to take command. Commodus also goes with him. As soon as Marcus reaches Germania, he falls sick. Marcus has the Antonine plague. The disease spread quickly through the empire due to its roads. 2000 people per day die in Rome at the peak of the disease, 25% of all infected perish. 5 MM Romans die and the army is almost wiped out. Marcus knows Commodus is still not ready to survive as Emperor, but there is no more time. Marcus dies In 180 AD telling Commodus to finish the war before going back to Rome. Marcus dies at 58, being Emperor for 20 yrs. He was regarded as a good Emperor of Rome and held in high regard by its people.

After Marcus, the losses in Germania continue to mount. The generals cant agree on a single, unified course of action to push back the Germans. Commodus has no interest in the war, as he has already seen 10 yrs of it. Cleander (Jared Turner) and Saoterus (Calum Gittins) are Commodus's closest friends and former slaves, who are promoted to the highest ranks in the Imperial palace. Cleander and Saoterus advise Commodus to be in Rome to assert his claims and dominance. Commodus had promised his father to end the war. To keep the promise, he makes a treaty with the Germanic tribes, which pushes them back from the border and forces many enemy soldiers to enlist in the Roman army. People liked the peace, but the military and senate were against the treaty. Commodus returns to Rome.

description: Commodus rises to power as Rome's new emperor, but not everyone supports his ascent. Among those conspiring against him: his older sister Lucilla.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Commodus rises to power as Rome's new emperor, but not everyone supports his ascent. Among those conspiring against him: his older sister Lucilla.

Commodus returns to ROme in 180 AD and is crowned Emperor in a public ceremony. Lucilla begins to seduce members of the senate (in bed) to gain influence. As the elder sister, she believed she had a better claim to the throne as compared to Commodus. Commodus realizes the politics at play to keep the throne. The demands of the Crown begin to weigh on him. Commodus plans to buy the loyalty of the military with a lavish gift. Historically, new emperors have given gifts like money, land and slaves to the soldiers to buy their support. But now, the treasury is controlled by the senate.

Senators Quintianus and Cassius Dio (Edwin Wright) support the plan in senate, but Commodus has no clue which lands to give to the military. So, Cassius and Quintianus take the allocation and distribution of land in their own hands. Quintianus was under Lucilla and planned to undermine Commodus by getting the senate to take credit for the gifts to the military. Cleander and Saoterus inform Commodus about the notification from Senate to the military, announcing the gift on the behalf of the Senate and not the emperor. Cleander wants to kill some senators to send a message, but Saoterus convinces Commodus to strike where it will hurt more, money. Commodus asks the senate to host a day of gladiator games (Starting with public executions, shows of wild exotic beasts, beast vs man or beast, and finally gladiatorial contests) as a gift to the people. When Senators say that games are expensive, and people cant be taxed for games, Commodus devises a plan to tax the senators to pay for the full cost of games

Quintianus is furious. And Cleander feels slighted when Commodus favors Saoterus's opinion more than his. Saoterus advises Commodus to focus on gaining support of the people. Commodus issues coins with his profile and launches statues of himself all over Rome. Lucilla and the senate's resentment peak at the same time and she plots with Quintianus to assassinate Commodus. Quintianus refuses to partake in this plot, of murdering a sitting emperor. Meanwhile Commodus rewards Saoterus with a signet ring, one of the highest honors in the palace (the signet ring was used to certify all documents from the emperor and now Saoterus had this power). This further alienates Cleander. Commodus appoints Saoterus to represent him in the senate, which the senate takes as an insult (Since Saoterus was formerly a slave). Not including the Senate in his inner circle was a major decision that Commodus made during his reign. Quintianus decides to partner with Lucilla to kill Commodus.

Cleander seduces Lucilla's chambermaid and finds out about her plot to kill Commodus. Cleander meets Lucilla and aligns with her in the plot to kill Commodus. Quintianus plans to kill Commodus at the games. Cleander promises to take out Saoterus, to eliminate any obstacles in their way. On the day of the games, Cleander takes Saoterus to a whore house. Saoterus falls asleep drunk and Cleander kills him in his sleep. Meanwhile Quintianus attacks Commodus when he comes to the basement of the Coliseum, after the games have begun.

description: Commodus defeats his sister's coup but withdraws from governing, allowing others to amass power while he engages in an affair and banishes his wife.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Commodus survives Quintianus's attack and captures him. Cleander reaches the palace and informs Commodus that they were ambushed by the plotters and Saoterus was killed in the attack. As Quintianus is tortured, Cleander cuts off his tongue to eliminate any chance of Quintianus naming Cleander in the conspiracy. Quintianus is killed and Cleander tells Commodus that Lucilla was involved in the plot.

Commodus confronts Lucilla, who admits that she plotted against Commodus as she was angry at being cast aside once Commodus was born. She wishes that Marcus would have set aside centuries of tradition (to put a male member of the royal family on the throne) and seen her as the worthy heir to the throne. Commodus spares Lucilla, but banishes her from Rome, to the Island of Capri (100 miles from Rome). Lucilla lives in exile. Shortly thereafter Commodus has her murdered on the Island. Cleander is promoted to chief advisor to Roman Emperor. Commodus displays that he is easily manipulated and instead of leading himself, he is put aside and led by people like Cleander.

Commodus withdraws into a shell. he even shuns his wife Bruttia since she has failed to give him a son. As Commodus grows more detached, Cleander continues to consolidate his power. Cleander begins selling off high ranking positions in the Empire, to amass a fortune for himself. he even sells seats in the Roman senate. With this move, Cleander buys the loyalty of the Senate and disturbs the balance of an institution that has governed for 700 yrs. Commodus returns to his reckless ways and starts having sex with Bruttia's chambermaid Marcia (Genevieve Aitken). Marcia was a slave, and now becomes a concubine to the Emperor. Commodus then sends Bruttia away to Capri on pretext of a plague, so he can have unhindered access to Marcia.

Next, Cleander aims to gain favor amongst the masses. For centuries ROme existed on imported grain from Egypt and North Africa. This grain was given free to each citizen of Rome. This was used by the elites to keep control of the lower classes. Cleander devises a plan to hoard the imported grains and create an artificial famine and then release the grain, emerging as the savior of the city and a hero. But the shortage of grain and resulting hunger leads to return of the plague in the city. Thousands die. riots break out. As news of hunger reaches Commodus, he orders Cleander to double the subsidies and to import more grain (Commodus knows hunger leads to sickness and sickness leads to death & anger). Commodus still continues to trust Cleander and doesn't realize the danger he poses to ROme. Cleander still sticks to his plan and refuses to release the grain. The anger of the population grows and they vent it out in form of graffiti on city's walls. Cleander is named as the person responsible (the man in charge of the supply of grain) for this mess. Commodus finally wakes up and realizes that Cleander has done something to provoke the anger of the masses.

description: A disastrous grain shortage reveals Cleander's treachery and leaves Commodus isolated, inspiring him to train as a gladiator in a bid to unite Rome.
synopsis_with_character_names:
A disastrous grain shortage reveals Cleander's treachery and leaves Commodus isolated, inspiring him to train as a gladiator in a bid to unite Rome.

Commodus arrests Cleander. Cassius argues that Cleander was behind the shortage of grain in Rome.
